dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tribe is gathered around the big fire pit. The tribe' SHAMAN, their medicine man and spirit leader, dances arou the fire in a boar's head mask, accessorized with way too many bones, beads and feathers. Zed and Oh are sitting near the fire, smoking something i long, decorated pipe.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Hey, Oh? Did it ever occur to you that there may be more to life than this?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (taking the pipe from Zed) Okay, I think somebody's had enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: No, thisworld, we hunt, we gather, we eat,we sleep, we make babies--

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: You make babies--

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: --but why? What's the point?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: You always get like this when you smoke. Oh takes a big toke on the pipe, chokes, and starts cough uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: No. Last night I couldn't sleep, so I just laid there looking up at the sky, counting the stars. There were over seventy. Kinda makes you think, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (looks up at the sky) No.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Really? I've been thinking about it ever since I ate that fruit. Don't you ever wonder what's on the other side of the mountains?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: There's nothing on the other side of the mountains. Everybody knows that. The world just ends. You'd fall right off the edge. (makes a sharp gesture)

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: But what if it doesn't? What if it just goes on and on forever? Or what if it's round? (he picks up a round

dialogues.speaker: ROCK
dialogues.text: And if you keep walking you eventually come right back to where you started? He traces the circumference with his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (SCOFFS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, that's plausible. Zed flings the rock away.

dialogues.speaker: A VILLAGER, (O.C.)
dialogues.text: Oww!

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (waves apologetically) Sorry!

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (tries to cheer him up Will you stop with that crazy talk? We're at a feast. You love feasts. There's women, there's boar meat, there's an assortment of berries-- there's women-- Oh looks over at Eema. Zed picks up on it.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Do it, man! Go dance for her.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: You think? They're playing the Jackal Dance. I don't do that one so well.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? Go! Jackal Dance! Oh summons his courage, gets up and crosses to where the girls are sitting. Zed makes subtle eye contact with Maya, waggles his eyebr and licks his lips. She laughs and looks away. Oh starts dancing timidly right in front of Eema, subtly jerking his pelvis, trying to be cool. Eema just stares at him for a moment, then goes back to talking to her friends. Oh looks over at Zed for help. Zed mimes clonking her on the head. Oh picks up a wooden club and hits Eema right on the nogg However, instead of submitting, she gets really pissed, stands up and decks him with one punch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White Eema glowers at Zed who feigns innocence.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 6 6 A hunter is slicing off hunks of boar meat for the other tribesmen. Zed pushes through the small crowd waiting for food and goes to the front.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Excuse me, hunter coming through.

dialogues.speaker: VILLAGERS
dialogues.text: Hey! Wait your turn! There's a line here, buddy!

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: For your information I was in line and I just stepped out to chew some food for an elderly lady. Suddenly a SPEAR is thrust inches from his face, stopping him. It's Marlak, who towers over Zed. His cohort, ENMEBARAGESI, short and stout, stands beside him.

dialogues.speaker: MARLAK
dialogues.text: Enmebaragesi said he saw you in the garden with Maya.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Oh, really? And what if I called Enmebaragesi a liar?

dialogues.speaker: ENMEBARAGESI
dialogues.text: I'd kill you.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Calm down. I said "what was a hypothetical. Marlak gets right in Zed's face.

dialogues.speaker: MARLAK
dialogues.text: Enmebaragesi doesn't lie. Villagers gather around them, Maya and Eema among them. Marlak puts his spear point to Zed's throat. MARLAK (cont'd) The truth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Zed, just admit it. You're just making it harder on yourself.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (instantly annoyed) No, you just made it harder on myself! (to Marlak) Okay, fine, you got me. (gingerly moves the spear

dialogues.speaker: POINT
dialogues.text: Maya and I lay together on occasion. We're consenting adults and we have an adventurous sexual relationship. Maya looks shocked, and tries to signal Zed to shut up.

dialogues.speaker: MARLAK
dialogues.text: (STUNNED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You laid with my woman?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Isn't that what we're talking about? Maya rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ENMEBARAGESI
dialogues.text: No, I saw you eat the Forbidden Fruit.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Oh, that! Yeah! I did eat the fruit. I was just kidding about humping Maya. Marlak knocks Zed to the ground. The DRUMMING stops. Oh comes running over and gets between Marlak and Zed.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (FORCEFUL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What's going on? Marlak growls at him.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (quickly looks up at the

dialogues.speaker: SKY
dialogues.text: Oooh, shooting star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White Zed gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Look, Marlak, this is crazy. You're two of me. I'm not gonna fight you over a girl, okay? Zed starts to walk away but quickly pivots and throws a W HAYMAKER at Marlak who easily ducks it, and it hits an unsuspecting Enmebaragesi squarely in the nose. Zed (to Enmebaragesi) And let that be a lesson to your big friend- Marlak grabs Zed, lands two solid punches to Zed's mid- section, and then clocks him with a vicious right that se him sprawling to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MARLAK
dialogues.text: (standing over Zed) Your father was a great hunter, but you're like-- a girl. The hunters laugh.

dialogues.speaker: ENMEBARAGESI
dialogues.text: Good one, Marlak.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER HUNTER
dialogues.text: Zing.

dialogues.speaker: MARLAK
dialogues.text: Now I kill you. He's about to spear Zed when suddenly the Shaman screams jumps between them. The villagers step back as the Shaman howls an incantation and shakes his magic rattle at Zed.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN
dialogues.text: (leaning close to Zed) We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 7 Zed and the Shaman sit side by side on a log, talking privately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White The Shaman is covered in skins, feathers, bones, beads, animal teeth, antlers and horns, his hair a mass of long, muddy dreadlocks, his face painted, his cheeks, nose, and ears pierced by shards of bone. But if not for his outlandish getup, zed could be talking to his pastor.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN
dialogues.text: You really ate the fruit?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: One bite! What's the big deal?

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN
dialogues.text: (halfheartedly shakes a chicken-foot rattle at

dialogues.speaker: HIM
dialogues.text: You don't eat the fruit! That's been the number one rule from the beginning of time. Since the Great Turtle climbed from the sea with the Earth on his back, drank the ocean, pooped out the mountains and the first man fell from the stars.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I've always had trouble with the Great Turtle Theory-- too many unexplained gaps.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN
dialogues.text: Whatever. You're screwed now.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Really? How screwed? Like I knew it was a rule but I'm a little fuzzy on the exact details.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN
dialogues.text: You're cursed, man, and if you stay here then we'll all be cursed. You have to leave.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Where am I supposed to go?

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN
dialogues.text: Up to you. From now on you're completely on your own.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (DEFIANT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Am I detecting a little jealousy here because I now have the knowledge of good and evil and you don't? Well, you know what? I say what I did was a good thing-- a very very good thing-- and I'm not leaving. What do you think of that? A HUMAN SKULL comes flying in from off-camera and lands a his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Okay, is that supposed to be funny? He stands up and we see that the whole tribe is standing around them in a wide circle. Marlak bangs his spear on the edge of his animal-hide shi starting a rhythmical beat. The other hunters join in, keeping the beat, staring at Zed with lethal intent

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN
dialogues.text: (to Zed, re the hunters) You should probably get going now. You better take this knife. He hands him a flint knife with a leather-wrapped handle.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN
dialogues.text: And some of the guys got together and they want you to have this bow. He hands him a strong hunter's bow.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I don't want to seem ungrateful or anything, but you wouldn't happen to have any arrows, would you? An arrow zips in and sticks in the post next to his head.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN
dialogues.text: (to Zed) You'd better get moving. Zed looks around at his fellow villagers, trying to summo what dignity he has left.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (DEFIANT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but before I go I just want to say something. I know I'm not the greatest hunter--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: VILLAGER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: --Or gatherer--

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Yes, or gatherer-- but there's got to be more to life than this-- (to Hunters) Kinda hard to concentrate with that rhythmic drumming, fellas. The Hunters keep the insistent beat, their gaze fixed on

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (rolls his eyes; "these guys are hopeless") Anyways, I'm going away, not because you're forcing me to-- which you are-- but because I choose to. Yes, I ate from the Tree of the Knowledge of Good and Evil-- major misunderstanding on my part-- and believe me I'm not recommending it unless you're interested in a very powerful laxative-- but it got me thinking about some pretty heavy stuff -- life questions, you know. So I'm out of here, and anyone who wants to join me is welcome. He looks around the circle and sees Maya. She sees Marlak staring at her and averts her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ANYONE--
dialogues.text: Zed looks at oh, who suddenly becomes very interested in imaginary piece of loincloth lint.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (looks directly at Oh) I don't know where we're going or when we're going to get there, but I will lead the way-- (he picks up a burning

dialogues.speaker: TORCH
dialogues.text: lighting up the darkness-- pointing us in the right direction, and keeping us entertained with humorous anecdotes from my childhood. Now who's with me? He enthusiastically thrusts the torch in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White Oh looks at Eema, then at Zed, and lowers his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Okay, then I guess I'll just have to go it alone, which is fine with

dialogues.speaker: ME--
dialogues.text: (to Oh) --better, in fact, because having a partner would just slow me down. Oh can't look at him. Zed shakes his head, failing to notice that the torch he' holding has ignited the roof of the hut next to him. The Shaman shouts and points at the now blazing roof.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Oops! They all stare as the fire quickly leaps from roof to roo

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I know there's a lesson in here somewhere. Any thoughts? The villagers scream and run off to try and save their hu It's chaos.

dialogues.speaker: MARLAK
dialogues.text: (raises his spear, to Zed) Now you die. Marlak throws his spear and misses as Zed takes off runni into the forest with the hunters right behind him and the whole village ablaze.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 8 Zed runs for his life through the dense forest. The hunters chase him, shooting arrows at him on a dead r Zed dodges as the arrows zip around him. He veers left, t right, then trips and tumbles down a muddy embankment. The hunters stop at the top of the embankment. Marlak listens for sounds of movement in the forest below, then silently signals for the hunters to fan out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White Marlak nimbly makes his way down the embankment, reaches bottom and sees something in the moonlight. It's Zed lying on the ground, badly camouflaged with stic and leaves, thinking he can't be seen, but the shape of h body is clearly discernible. Marlak raises his spear.

dialogues.speaker: MARLAK
dialogues.text: I see you.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (long beat) No, you don't.

dialogues.speaker: MARLAK
dialogues.text: Yes, I do.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: How can you see me if I'm not here?

dialogues.speaker: MARLAK
dialogues.text: You're trying to trick me.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Okay, then tell me this-- who's standing right behind you?

dialogues.speaker: MARLAK
dialogues.text: (nobody's fool) You think I'm going to turn around and look, but I'm not. (pulls his knife) I'm going to gut you like a pig. He is about to plunge his knife into Zed when suddenly he struck from behind by a heavy tree branch. He falls heavi knocked senseless by Oh who is standing over him with the makeshift club. Zed sits up and smiles gratefully at Oh.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: I guess I'm with you.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Was it my speech?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: No, the fire. I lost everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: But the speech was pretty good, right? I mean, even I was moved and I was the one speaking.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Can we talk about this later? Oh pulls Zed to his feet, and they sneak off into the dee woods.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: 9 CRICKETS. Zed and Oh walk through the moonlit forest.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: This is nice, out here, the two of us.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (SULLEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's great.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Come on, those hunters are idiots. In an hour they'll forget the whole thing.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: I don't think they'll forget the fire.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: You know what we should do? You and me should kill the biggest boar ever-- just huge!-- and take it back to the village. Just to show them. And we won't let anyone else eat it. They'll have to watch us eat it.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: If it's that huge how would we carry it back?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (CONSIDERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, we'll just start with something small. A squirrel or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Yeah, we'll make everyone watch us eat a squirrel. Will you get real? There's no going back! There's, nothing to go back to! It's just ashes.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (SCOFFS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, like it's so hard to build a new hut. It's just a pile of sticks and dung--

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (SCOWLS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a pile of sticks and dung. Suddenly, Zed stops and stands perfectly still.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (through clenched teeth) Oh!

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Zed makes a minimal gesture with his head. Oh looks up. A COUGAR crouches on a tree limb above them, poised to le Oh freezes. They talk like ventriloquists.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Don't move a muscle.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Will that work?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (without moving his lips) I don't know. There's two different opinions on this one. Some say run, some say don't.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I'm going to-- RUN! He sprints off and the cougar pounces right on oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White 10 Zed is holding a stick over the fire, cooking what looks a squirrel or a muskrat. Oh comes out of the forest carrying a huge armload of sti and branches. One of Oh's sticks falls, and as he careful reaches down to grab it, the rest spill out on the ground Oh sighs. His body is covered with long claw marks.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: You really should put some maggots on those scratches. They look pretty deep.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (BITTER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to know why you told me not to move, and you ran.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Because I honestly thought he'd go for me. I thought I was doing you a favor. Apparently not appreciated.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Yeah, big favor.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: You didn't have to come with me, you know. I didn't ask you to come.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Yes, you did! You looked right at me-- twice.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Yes, that's a technique of public speaking, but I didn't ask you specifically. You chose to come. You gotta take some responsibility for that. And there's no point coming if you're just gonna keep whining about every little-- cougar that attacks you. (pulls the cooked rodent from the fire) You want some or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (HUFFY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, eat your weasel. You deserve it. He turns his back to Zed, and starts sorting through the of sticks.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: You making your own fire?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: No, arrows. We're going to need them.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (perks up) You're still coming?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (RESIGNED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Zed claps him on the back and hugs him exuberantly. Oh winces in pain.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 11 Zed and Oh are hiking uphill, the lush, dense verdure of forest now thinning to evergreens and mountain heather.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 12 Zed and Oh climbing higher now. Finally, they reach the t and look out at the vista. From their vantage point they can see a high plateau and wooded land stretching far beyond it.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (GLOATING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it! Still think you're just gonna fall off the edge of the world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (in amazement) Incredible. He takes a step forward, the rock shelf gives way beneath feet and he falls a great distance, screaming all the way down, bouncing painfully off the big boulders, then a lon tumbling slide over sharp rocks and gravel to the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (WINCES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh. (then calls out) I'll go around! Wait for me!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 13 Zed is following a trail downhill through the forest on t other side of the mountains. Oh is limping along behind h bitten, clawed, cut, scraped and bruised.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Say what you want, but that was no accident. You don't see a pattern here?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: I see a pattern. Every time something terrible can happen to me, it does.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Yeah, but why? Why'd the cougar go for you and not me? Why did you fall and I didn't? Hard to believe it's all just random. Think about

dialogues.speaker: J
dialogues.text: looks around the forest clearing for subtle signs.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (sniffing the air) People-- more than one-- walking-- (he guesses) that way.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (looking around) You think? There's about a thousand footprints here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White He indicates the heavily trampled forest floor.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (ignores him) Yes! There! He drops to one knee and examines something in the bushes Zed They stopped here to poop. Look.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Four men, maybe five. And a child-- or a small women maybe.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (a little disgusted) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (poking at the evidence) Looks like they had some nuts-- dried fruit-- some kind of green leafy vegetable--

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Okay! Enough! Can we just go? Maybe we can find where they peed. 14 stealthily to the tree line. Oh creeps up beside him and they peer through the bushes. THREE COWS are grazing in a green pasture. Beyond it, wel tended fields of growing grain. Zed snaps into stalking mode, ducks down and silently sig Oh to be quiet and stay put.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (WHISPERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's mine. He takes his bow, pulls an arrow from his quiver, and slo draws the bow, taking deadly aim at one of the cows. He shoots. The blunt, pointless arrow hits the cow in the side and bounces off. The cow looks up.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (to Oh) We're gonna need some arrowheads. Zed draws his flint knife, then suddenly bursts out of th forest, dashes toward the cow and leaps on its back. Oh comes running up as the cow bucks and sends Zed flying Lying on the ground, Zed looks up and sees TWO SURPRISED YOUNG FARMERS dressed in simple white woolen tunics stari at him.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST YOUNG FARMER
dialogues.text: Did you just shoot my cow?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (getting painfully to his

dialogues.speaker: FEET
dialogues.text: Yeah, well-- we're hunters.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (covering for himself) He's a hunter. I'm more of a "maker." I made this loincloth, I do arrows-- I made a shelf unit for my hut--

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: What do you guys do?

dialogues.speaker: SECOND YOUNG FARMER
dialogues.text: What does it look like? We're farmers.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST YOUNG FARMER
dialogues.text: He's a farmer; I'm a herdsman.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND YOUNG FARMER
dialogues.text: You're a suck, is what you are.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST YOUNG FARMER
dialogues.text: (ignores him) My brother, Cain. I am called Abel.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: You are called suck.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: My brother is angry because God looked on my sacrifice with favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White                                  28.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (mimics him) "God looked on my sacrifice with

dialogues.speaker: FAVOR--"
dialogues.text: (to Oh) Okay, is he a total suck or what?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Well, it's hard to say-- we just

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Why are you dragging them into this? What do they know? They're morons.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (OFFENDED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Easy!

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (to Abel) You think you're so superior to everyone else.

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Superior-er than you.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Really? Let's see how good you are at getting your ass kicked. (shoves him)

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: Yeah? Bring it! (shoves him back)

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Okay, boys, that's enough. We just want to--

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (won't let it go) No! This smug asshole insulted you and I want him to take it back.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: We're not really that insulted--

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (pushes Abel hard) Take it back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ABEL
dialogues.text: (pushes back) Make me! Zed steps between them, trying to make peace.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Boys, boys! You're brothers! Let's just relax and-- Cain uses the distraction to sneak-punch Abel and the fig is on. They start throwing wild punches, then clinch and wrestle each other to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we do something?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Just let them settle it. Cain picks up a good-size rock and strikes Abel on the he with all his might. Abel falls heavily to the ground and lies there, not moving. Cain stands over him, breathing hard.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (SHOCKED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that settles it.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (turns on him sharply, still holding the bloody

dialogues.speaker: ROCK
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Nothing! Cain stares at Abel, still inert on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: He's all right. Probably just

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (humoring him) Probably just tuckered out from the fight.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (looking around nervously) Yeah. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAIN                                       (cont'd) Maybe I should throw some dirt on him-- keep him warm 'til he wakes up. He starts kicking dirt over Abel's body. CAIN                                       (cont'd) (getting worried) This is bad. This is really bad. We're in serious trouble.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Hey! What do you mean "we"? I don't want to play the blame game, but you're the one who hit him.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (turns on them) You could've stopped me! There's two of you and only one of me.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: We didn't know you were going to kill him--

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: You calling me a murderer? (he clutches the rock)

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Did I say that?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: It was an accident! (to Oh) Right?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Right! You were holding the rock and he-- accidentally ran into it-- really hard-- with his head.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (calming down) Okay-- yeah-- good. But it might be better if we don't mention the "accident" to anyone. People might get the wrong idea. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, people could so easily misinterpret that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (SHRUGS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why even bring it up?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you guys. You're all right. Why don't you come with me? Have supper with the family.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Unfortunately we already have dinner plans.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: I think you should come with me.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (his idea) why don't we go with you?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 15 Cain finishes loading bushels of grain onto an oxcart whi Zed and Oh closely inspect the big, heavy, solid wooden wheels on the cart.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: What are the big round things for?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: They're wheels, numbskull. They make the cart roll.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (blown away) Wow! That is like the greatest invention since the vagina. Cain whips the oxen and they lumber forward. Oh screams as the HEAVY WHEELS ROLL OVER HIS FEET.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 16 They look really thrilled, wind blowing through their hai their hands up like roller-coaster riders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED AND OH
dialogues.text: (WHOOPING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woooo! Woooo! Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: THE CART
dialogues.text: with them riding on it, plodding slowly into a FARMING HAMLET,Г‚В°a cluster of small, roughly plastered mud hous thatched roofs. ADAM, dour, hard-working and long-suffering, but still st and upright, trudges home with a metal scythe over his shoulder. He could be Max Von Sydow.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (hailing Cain) Cain, my son!

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Hail, Father. Cain stops the cart and dismounts with Zed and Oh.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Can these guys stay for supper? (off Adam's questioning

dialogues.speaker: LOOK
dialogues.text: I bring strangers who would sojourn with us this night. Cain turns to Zed and Oh and furtively mimes an elaborate sewing gesture, ancient precursor to the modern lip-zippe

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Greetings, strangers. I am called Adam and you are welcome to share the fruits of our toil.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Thanks, but I'm kind of staying away from fruit for the time being. Zed gives Cain a subtle, acquiescent nod as Adam ushers t into his crude dwelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White 17 17 The rude dwelling has a stark, somber, almost Amish feeli to it. Zed and Oh sit at the table sharing a simple meal with Adam, Cain and his Adam's wife EVE and h them, Lilith's tunic gaping open to reveal her breasts ev time she leans over to put something on the table. Zed an Oh can't take their eyes off her.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (to Cain) Where is thy brother, Abel?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (badly overplaying) Abel? Haven't seen him. I thought he was with you. (to Zed and Oh) You guys see him? They shake their heads and cough nervously.

dialogues.speaker: ZED AND OH
dialogues.text: (equally unconvincing) Nape. Not that I remember. Never seen anybody-- anywhere-- anytime -- ever.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (to Cain) Your sister Lilith said she saw him in the field with you.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: I think that was yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No, this day. She said you both made offerings.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: That might've been Boaz---

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: No, you and Abel. She said it looked like you were arguing.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Hey, we're brothers, we argue sometimes- it's not that big a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: And his flock was untended in the

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (EXPLODES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! What am I-- his keeper? Get off my back, will you? He smashes his plate against the wall and storms out. An awkward silence as Zed and Oh exchange guilty looks.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: I fear the worst for Abel. I am sorely vexed.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's got to be pretty vexing. A Bergmanesque gloom fills the hovel as Adam muses sullen on his sorry circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: For my sin the ground is cursed. Thorns and thistles does it sprout for us, and we are doomed to toil all the days of our lives. For as the Lord has commanded, by the sweat of your brow shall you get bread to eat until you return to the ground from which you were taken. For dust you are, and to dust shall you return.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Wow. That's kind of a downer isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: It's the way of the world.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Boy, I hope not.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (rises abruptly) You are welcome to stay the night and lay with my daughter Lilith. Zed looks at the luscious Lilith, then back at Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I'm waiting for the punchline.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: She is without a husband, and as the Lord has said, thou shalt be fruitful and multiply. Lilith nods demurely and exits through a curtain. Zed sta to follow her out.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Hey! What about me?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You may share the bed of my son Seth.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Yeah, there you go. (he exits) Oh looks at Seth.

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: I multiplied with a sheep. (Oh just stares at him) My thingie smells like lamb chops. 18 Zed enters the room. Lilith reclines on a cot with a stra mattress.

dialogues.speaker: LILITH
dialogues.text: (making room on the cot) My bed is small but you're welcome to share it. It's the way of my people.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (lying down beside her) And that's a good way to be. In fact, I'm kind of surprised a pretty girl like you is sleeping alone anyway. I would've thought guys would be lined up at the door.

dialogues.speaker: LILITH
dialogues.text: I don't like men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (moving closer) Maybe you just haven't met the right one.

dialogues.speaker: LILITH
dialogues.text: I like girls.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (SUAVE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we have that in common--

dialogues.speaker: LILITH
dialogues.text: (stares at him for a beat) I'm attracted to women.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (a beat) I don't even know what that means. What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: LILITH
dialogues.text: I like to have sex with other women.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (stares at her for a long

dialogues.speaker: MOMENT
dialogues.text: I'm really not getting this. Lilith shakes her head, turns away from him, and pulls up blanket. Zed shrugs and rolls over to sleep. They lie the quietly in the dark for a long beat. Then-- Zed You're kidding! Whoa! That's amazing! 19 Oh is lying next to Seth, wide-awake, trying to stay as f away from him as possible.

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: Oooh, listen to this one. Seth lifts his knees to his chest and farts a surprisingl long cadenza.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: That's really good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: SETH
dialogues.text: Want to see a trick?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Do I have to?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 20 In the yard behind the house, Oh is helping Cain as he ch firewood with a metal axe. Oh now wears a tunic like the farmers.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: It's been the same damn thing my whole life. (swings the axe-- thwack!) "Why can't you be more like Abel?" (thwack!) "Oh, your sacrifice was good, too, but Abel's was-- wow!" (thwack!)

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (trying to change the

dialogues.speaker: SUBJECT
dialogues.text: Your brother Seth is an interesting guy. Did you know he can put his penis in his mouth? Adam and Zed come out of his dwelling. KINSMEN from other dwellings start gathering.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Cain!

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, hey-- where's everybody going?

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: To look for Abel.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (MUTTERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (louder, mock sincerity) I said good luck. I'm really worried about him. He turns aside and makes a goofy sarcastic face for Oh's benefit.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: You're not coming?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I am. I just have to finish toiling over here, then I'm right behind you. Adam and the others hurry off, and as soon as they're gon Cain rushes over and starts harnessing the oxen to the ca

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (to Zed and Oh) Now listen, I'm getting out of here, and you better come with me. I have a feeling they're going to try and blame this whole "Abel- killing-thing" on you.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Why would they blame us?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Because when they find him and his head is all bashed in, they're going to start pointing fingers, and you guys are drifters, so they'll put two and two together and that makes-- He stares expectantly at Zed and Oh.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Four! It makes four! Now stop asking so many questions and hop on. We gotta get out of here! He urgently whips the oxen and they climb aboard as the c lumbers forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 21 21 Adam and the other farmers discover Abel's body.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: (BITTERLY)

dialogues.speaker: CAIN--
dialogues.text: (to the others) After him! The farmers shout and race back to the hamlet.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 22 22 Adam and the other farmers jump onto two more oxcarts and out after Cain, Zed and Oh.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 23 Cain's cart lumbers along. He looks back over his shoulde

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (urgently, to Zed and Oh) They're gaining on us! Zed and Oh look back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other oxcarts are a hundred yards back, "chasing" the maybe two miles per hour. Cain whips his oxen and they step up the pace to 3 MPH.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (GLEEFUL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah! They'll never catch us now! An aerial view shows Cain's cart slowly pulling away from pursuers. Suddenly a bolt of lightning splits the bright blue sky a strikes Cain right on the forehead, knocking him back int the cart. He sits up stunned, with a still-smoking, jagge burn mark on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (dazed but exhilarated) Wow! What are the odds of that?! (feeling the burn mark) Am I lucky or what? Zed and Oh exchange doubtful looks and glance nervously a the sky.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 24 The ox cart approaches a small trading settlement on the seacoast, a kind of makeshift tent city around a central marketplace. Several dhows are tied up at the shore, came and pack animals are tethered on the fringes, while TRADE and MERCHANTS inspect newly arrived goods and haggle over prices. 25 Zed, Oh and Cain wander through the crowded market. PEOPL OF EVERY RACE dressed in all manner of exotic garb buy, s and barter goods from distant lands. Zed and oh gawk like couple of yokels.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Look at all these people! And this stuff! Oh approaches a bakery stand and stares hungrily at the bread.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (to the Merchant) Can I have one of those? He reaches for a loaf but the MERCHANT strikes his hand w a cane.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: MERCHANT
dialogues.text: Two silver pieces.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (HUNGRY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna need some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're gonna need money. (an afterthought) What's money? They see a crowd at the center of the market gathered aro a raised platform. SLAVES IN SHACKLES are lined up on the raised wooden plat while CUSTOMERS examine those waiting to be auctioned. The AUCTIONEER brings up a fnuscular male slave in a loincloth.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: It's Marlak! Marlak's hands are bound and he's restrained by a chain attached to a thick leather collar around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: AUCTIONEER
dialogues.text: (addresses the crowd) Next up, an unusual item-- looks like a Caucasian-- he's big, he's strong, he's a good breeder, so I'm going to start at Do I hear As the bidding starts, Zed spots Maya, his sister Eema, a Enmebaragesi among the chained-up slaves waiting to be so Zed and Oh push their way through the crowd and go to the

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (amazed to see them) Eema! Maya! The women embrace him with relief and excitement.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (SHEEPISH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Eema.

dialogues.speaker: EEMA
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: What happened? How did you get here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official white

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Well, after the fire-- (she shoots him an accusing look)) --the hill tribes raided the village. The men fought them but they were too many. They took us captive, marched us to the sea, then traded us to the boat people who brought us here.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (to Eema) Are you all right? Did they-- rape you?

dialogues.speaker: EEMA
dialogues.text: (SHRUGS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little. Zed and Oh look at her curiously. The SLAVE TRADER sees them talking to Eema and approaches

dialogues.speaker: SLAVE TRADER
dialogues.text: You interested in some slaves?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (like a prospective buyer) Yeah, this one looks pretty good-- He starts prodding, poking and squeezing Maya's arm like buying fruit. Oh takes the opportunity to fondle Eema's breasts. She punches him. Zed Ooh, feisty! So how does this work if we want them? The slave trader notes Zed's peasant clothes.

dialogues.speaker: SLAVE TRADER
dialogues.text: You have money?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (CAGEY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that depends on what you mean by money?

dialogues.speaker: SLAVE TRADER
dialogues.text: Look, pal, money talks and bullshit walks. I don't have time for looky- loos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official white Cain steps up and intercedes.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (GRANDLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps I can help. (confidentially to Zed and

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Let me talk to the guy. Maybe I can make a deal with him. You guys wait here. Cain puts his arm around the slave trader's shoulder and walks him away.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (to the slave trader) So what are we lookin' at here? From a distance, Zed and Oh watch them talking, but can't hear what they're saying.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (to Eema) What an amazing coincidence-- running into you and Maya and them.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: You still think it's all just a coincidence? now, at this particular place, at this particular time?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (THINKS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Why do you think?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I'm not sure yet, but I'm starting to believe that everything happens for a reason. Like, why did I eat the forbidden fruit?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: To get laid?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White                                   44. Okay, that might have been what I was thinking at the time, but what if some omnipotent force put the fruit there because I was supposed to eat it?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: which omnipotent force?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: What do you mean "which" omnipotent force? How many omnipotent forces could there be?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: I don't know! What's "omnipotent" mean?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Work with me-- I'm just speculating here. Let's call this force "God"; and let's say this "God" is controlling everything. Maybe God wanted me to have the knowledge of good and evil.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Why would he want that?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: How do you know God's a "He?" Zed rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Don't you get what I'm saying? What if we've been chosen?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: You think we've been chosen by God?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Well, no offense, but it's possible that I was chosen and you all just happened to be there.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Why would God choose you? Why wouldn't he choose Marlak? He's stronger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: A chosen doesn't need to be strong. I'm big this way. (points to his temples)

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: You do have a fat face.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Not my face, my brain. It's enormous. I'm the smartest guy in the village.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (SCOFFS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not even-- I'm smarter than you!

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: What?! (to ANOTHER VILLAGER) Which one of us is smarter?

dialogues.speaker: VILLAGER
dialogues.text: You're both idiots!

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, then why are we free and you're chained up?

dialogues.speaker: VILLAGER
dialogues.text: Because of you?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (calls them over) Hey! Come here. I think we worked something out.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (confidently, to Maya) Sit tight. I'm going to get you out of here. Do you trust me?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (HEDGING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to trust you.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Fair enough. She gives him an encouraging hug, then Zed and Oh cross t Cain and the slave trader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (to Cain) Good work. What's the deal? The slave owner smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 26 Zed and Oh are dragged onto the platform in shackles and irons. They see Cain riding off on a donkey. He holds up a bag o coins and waves goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I never trusted that guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Just 'cause he murdered his brother and got hit by lightning? They are pushed to the front of the platform.

dialogues.speaker: SLAVE TRADER
dialogues.text: (to the crowd) All right! Next up is a twofer-- I'm selling them as a pair-- I know they don't look like much-- but I'm starting the bidding at sixty gold minas. Do I hear sixty? (NOTHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, it's two for one here. Do I hear fifty? Anyone? That's only twenty-five apiece, folks. (NOTHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed looks out at the crowd, starting to get offended. SLAVE TRADER (cont'd) You're breaking my heart here. How about forty? Do I hear forty? (NOTHING)

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (to Oh) It's not like I want to be a slave or anything, but this is embarrassing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official white

dialogues.speaker: SLAVE TRADER
dialogues.text: Thirty-five? Thirty?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (SHOUTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, people! We're a steal at thirty!

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: They probably don't know how smart you think you are. Finally, a Bedouin SHEIK raises his giraffe-tail fly whis and waves it at the slave trader.

dialogues.speaker: SLAVE TRADER
dialogues.text: Yes! Sold to Sheikh Hassan for gold minas! (to Zed and Oh) Have a good time in the salt mines, boys.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 27 A small CARAVAN OF CAMELS AND DONKEYS loaded with trade g moves across the arid wasteland. The effete SHEIKH rides lead camel, protected from the blistering sun by a colorf canopy. A FEW ARMED BEDOUIN GUARDS ride alongside. Bringing up the rear is A LARGE FOUR-WHEELED CART DRAWN B HORSES, basically a cage on wheels into which TWENTY NEWL PURCHASED SLAVES have been crammed, jammed together like sardines. Zed and Oh are in the middle of the body pile, literally cheek by jowl with the other slaves, barely able to move. Eema is right next to Oh, her body pressed tight against Oh shifts around, repositioning his arms and body trying get more comfortable and give Eema a little space, but he just ends up touching her even more.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (EMBARRASSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me-- I'm sorry-- (his hand gets stuck between her breasts) That's not good-- He jerks his hand away, elbowing Marlak in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White Marlak growls and grabs Oh by the throat, but the struggl forces everyone else to shift which causes even more discomfort.

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER SLAVES
dialogues.text: Ow! Hey! Cut that out! Zed tries to turn his head to see who's behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (GROUCHY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, pal! You can take your foot out of my ass anytime now. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your foot is still there. If I turn around, you will be sorry. Zed twists violently and manages a full turn which brings face to face and crotch to crotch with Maya.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: That's better.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: For you maybe.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Look, I want you to know I blame myself for everything that happened.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: So does everybody else.

dialogues.speaker: MARLAK
dialogues.text: (over his shoulder) Get away from my woman!

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (IRRITATED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's going to be possible. And I told you before, she's not "your woman."

dialogues.speaker: MARLAK
dialogues.text: I'll kill you! Marlak starts muscling and squirming his way through the pile trying to get to Zed.

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER SLAVES
dialogues.text: Hey! Watch it, jerk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White It's too cramped to even throw a punch, so Marlak uses a RANDOM SLAVE'S HEAD as a weapon to bang against zed's hea repeatedly.

dialogues.speaker: RANDOM SLAVE
dialogues.text: (MEEKLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Suddenly Zed feels Marlak's hands around his neck, grabbi him from behind. Zed struggles but Marlak manages to pull him into a full headlock, forcing Zed's face into his hai armpit.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (MUFFLED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ecchhh! Oh is vaguely aware of the fight going on but can't move.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (calling to Zed) Hold on! I'm coming! Oh tries to maneuver to Zed, but can't move an inch.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: If everyone could just move to the right. Please? Thank you in advance for your cooperation. (then, giving up hope) You can do it, Zed! Use his weight against him! 28 A BEDOUIN GUARD notices the commotion and bangs the bars the cage with his staff.

dialogues.speaker: BEDOUIN
dialogues.text: (shouts at the slaves) Knock it off! Don't make me come in there!

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (MASHED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to see you try. The Bedouin is just about to respond when suddenly A META TIPPED ARROW FLIES IN AND PIERCES HIS THROAT. He drops to the sand, dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: A BATTLE CHARIOT
dialogues.text: comes flying over the crest of the wadi followed by TWENT ARMORED FOOT SOLDIERS wearing bronze helmets and breastplates. The soldiers attack the caravan, slashing and slicing the Bedouin guards. Their commander, SARGON, his helmet topped with a magnifi plume, rides up in the chariot and with one mighty stroke his sword cuts the head off ANOTHER BEDOUIN GUARD. Marlak reaches through the bars, grabs the fallen Bedouin sword and hacks off the lock on the door of the slave wag The door flies open and the slaves tumble, jump and stumb out onto the ground. Zed and Oh look around, gawking at the massacre taking pl Then Zed sees Marlak, sword in hand, looking for him.

dialogues.speaker: SARGON
dialogues.text: (shouts an order) Take the slaves! Marlak starts for Zed but two soldiers ride up and throw heavy restraining net over him. Zed grabs oh and takes off running over the nearest sand dune. Sargon watches them flee.

dialogues.speaker: A SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Sir, shall I pursue them?

dialogues.speaker: SARGON
dialogues.text: No. Let the desert have them. They won't get far.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 29 The soldiers are camped for the night. The slaves are bac in their cage. Sargon the commander stops to instruct the GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: SARGON
dialogues.text: Tend to the slaves. We leave for Sodom before daybreak.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. 30 30 They lie hidden behind a sandy ridge watching from a shor distance.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (WHISPERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder who they are. Their hats are really great, aren't they?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Their hats? I'm sorry, but when that one guy cut the other guy's head off, my first thought wasn't, "Gee, what a great hat."

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: It wasn't my very first thought, but I'd be lying if I said it wasn't up there. (WATCHFUL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we just need to figure out a way to rescue Maya and Eema.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: How are we going to rescue anybody? They're killers!

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (WILY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patience, my friend. Even killers have to sleep sometime. He keeps a sharp, wakeful eye on the enemy camp.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: 31 Zed and Oh fast asleep on the ridge. They slowly wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (SCRATCHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that was refreshing. How'd you sleep?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (YAWNS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that well. I think I was over- tired. Then Zed suddenly remembers Maya. He looks and sees that soldiers and slaves are long gone.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Shit! He leaps to his feet, looks around desperately, and sees nothing but a vast wasteland in every direction.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Now where do we go? Zed sniffs the air, puts his ear to the ground, and taste the sand.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 32 trudging across the desert in the blistering heat, growin weaker, stumbling and falling.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (too weak to move) Why do I listen to you? Now we're going to starve to death or die of thirst.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Will you stop being so negative? I got your back, man. Who saved you from those lions when you were a baby? They were going to pounce, had you surrounded. Took the mama lion-- BAM!-- kneed her right in the face. Papa lion comes flying at me-- BAM!-- dropped an elbow, knocked his ass out. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Took his legs-- THWOOM!-- tossed him in the river. And the rest just ran off.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: You know, I've asked people about that and no one else seems to remember it.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Yeah, because nobody else was there. You're lucky I was walking by. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, it's possible I dreamed that-- but who practically raised you after your father was dragged off by those raccoons? Not a dignified death.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (practically delirious) He was a small man. Oh collapses face down in the sand. Pull back to reveal that they are surrounded by hungry jackals, vultures and hyenas.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: We've got to keep moving. (hauls Oh to his feet) I've got you, buddy-- just like always. He puts Oh over his shoulder and stumbles on. 33 A MAN in his sixties, tall, full beard, piercing eyes and fierce nose, dressed in a robe and kafiyya, arranges fire on a large flat rock. His TEENAGE SON looks around curiously. They are ABRAHAM and ISAAC.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Hey, Dad? We making a burnt offering?

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: Yes, Isaac. As God has commanded me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (CONFUSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see the sheep.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: The Lord will provide the sheep. Abraham takes a cord and starts tying Isaac's hands toget

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (NERVOUSLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-- is this like a magic trick? Without another word Abraham takes strong hold of Isaac a lifts him up onto the firewood.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (really scared now) Okay, if this is because I didn't clean up my tent, you can stop now. I get it. Then Abraham pulls a long slaughtering knife from beneath robe.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (PANICKED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, this isn't funny anymore! Abraham raises the knife.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: I'm telling mom! The knife flashes in the sun as it descends toward the bo

dialogues.speaker: STOP
dialogues.text: Abraham and Isaac both turn to see Zed and Oh step out fr behind the rocks. Their clothes are tattered and they are burnt raw by the sun.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: What are you doing to that kid?

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (INNOCENTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: What do you mean, nothing? You were just going to kill him!

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: No, I was going to sacrifice him. There's a difference.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (indicating Isaac) Not to him, I'm guessing. Isaac nods gratefully.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: By what right do you interfere? Art thou an angel of the Lord?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (good question) What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (nods sagely) Verily, thou wast sent to stay my hand by the Eternal one, blessed be He.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (NODS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you just said. Oh helps Isaac off the altar stone and unties him.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (confidentially to Oh) He's nuts! I'm telling you-- he's totally lost it.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (to Zed) I am Abraham, son of Terah of the house of Nahor.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I am Zed and this is Oh, sons of-- people you wouldn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: The tents of my kinsmen lie just beyond. There will you find all that you desire. Come.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 34 Abraham leads Isaac, Zed and Oh past the colorful his people. The camp is alive with activity. 35 The spacious tent is lit by torches, and a feast is in progress. TWENTY OR THIRTY BEARDED MEN in skullcaps and l robes lounge on cushions or sit cross-legged in a circle the carpeted floor. An EGYPTIAN BELLY DANCER shakes her hips for the pleasure Abraham who occupies the place of honor. Zed and oh, now also wearing robes and skullcaps, are sit right beside him eating and drinking everything in sight. Isaac sits beside them. ABRAHAM claps his hands for attention. Zed and Oh look up the music stops.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (to the assembly) My brothers, let us give thanks unto God for staying my hand on the mountain this day.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (humoring him) Best dad in all the land, everyone!

dialogues.speaker: THE KINSMEN
dialogues.text: (a ritual response, in

dialogues.speaker: UNISON
dialogues.text: Praise be to God, hallowed be His name.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: And for the bounty which He hath bestowed unto us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official white

dialogues.speaker: THE KINSMEN
dialogues.text: (in unison) He hath increased our wealth and blessed us with His loving kindness. Zed and Oh mutter along, trying to fit in.

dialogues.speaker: ZED AND OH
dialogues.text: (a beat late) --mumble mumble mumble loving kindness. Abraham looks at them.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: Friends, whence comest thou? Zed and Oh look at each other blankly.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (HELPFULLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to know where you're from.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (SUSPICIOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thou comest not from the cities of the plain? From Sodom or Gomorrah? Zed perks up at the mention of Sodom, recalling the destination of the soldiers who took Maya and the others.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Sodom and Gomorrah? Never been there. But I've heard of them.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Are they nice?

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: The Lord has cursed them for their abomination.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (nods gravely) i didn't know that. What kind of abomination are we talking about?

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: They bow down before false Gods and worship graven images.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (clicks his tongue) Abominable.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: The men of the city are weak and soft, fat with rich food, intoxicated by strong drink.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (sounds good to him) Really. Tell me more.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: Their women are whores; their shameless lust knows no bounds. They flaunt their flesh without shame and any man may have knowledge of them.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (he's sold) And where exactly are those cities?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (off Abraham's stern look) We just want to know so we can avoid them.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (FIERCELY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk not the path of Sodom! For surely will the Lord send his holy fire to destroy the city and all who dwell within, to smite them and all their seed for their iniquity.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (CONCERNED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do you think all this smiting is going to go down? We may have some friends there.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (getting up) Accompany me. Abraham sweeps out of the tent. Zed and Oh jump to their feet and follow. Isaac tags along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official white 36 Abraham walks to the edge of the desert. Torchlight from camp flickers on his face as he gazes across the desolate moonlit landscape.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Abraham, I'm a little worried about the city being destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: Their fate is sealed. But for my faith and devotion, the self-same God has given unto me the whole of this land, from the Jordan to the Negev, from the river of Egypt to the great Euphrates. This did He grant to me and my seed. He raises his arms and spreads them wide.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (IMPRESSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all your land?

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: For eternity.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (SCOFFS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, God just forgot to tell anyone else. we're having a war with someone like every five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: (scowls at him) I and my kinsmen have vanquished our enemies by the mighty hand of the Lord, praised be He. Zed and Oh fake their way through a ritual response.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: His name is praise and love his whole graciousness--

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: --of his wealthy bounty. Abraham gets a strange faraway look in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: Therefore, to signify my Covenant with the One True God, on this night will I circumcise the flesh of my foreskin, and of you and every male who dwells hereby.

dialogues.speaker: ZED OH
dialogues.text: Excuse me?                                          I'm n

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Here we go again--

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: we will grasp the foreskins of our penises and cut therefrom the extra flesh.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (AGHAST)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure I have any extra.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Couldn't we could just get our ears pierced?

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (aside to Zed) Okay, what did I tell you-- nuts?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: You know, Abe, it's late, and we've all had a lot to drink, and I know this whole foreskin thing sounds like a good idea now, but you may just want to sleep on it. we could always cut 'em off in the morning, but if we do it now, there's just no putting it back on later.

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: No. So it shall be written, so it shall be done. (to Isaac) Get my big knife. Zed and Oh both reflexively cover their crotches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official white 37 Zed and oh stumble over the rocky hills. They hear a PAIN SCREAM from someone being circumcised back at Abraham's c

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: You have any idea where we're going?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: To the city. I have to find Maya.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: The city! He said God's going to smite them with holy fire!

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: And you're going to listen to him? You think he's more chosen than me?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: He seemed to know what he was talking about.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Yes, and he also wanted to give his dick a little trim.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Hey, wait up! Zed and Oh turn to see Isaac running towards them.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (out of breath) I'm coming with you.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: You don't even know where we're going.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: You're going to Sodom, right?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: No. Your dad specifically said Sodom and Gomorrah were evil.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Yeah, whatever. If I show you how to get there, will you buy me a bottle of wine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: No! I told you, that's not where we're going.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Fine. Then we'll just stand here.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Fine. They stand there for less than a beat.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Okay, you win. Take us to Sodom. Isaac takes a couple of steps to the top of a rise and po off in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shining in the moonlight, the magnificent city of Sodom s atop a broad hill surrounded by high walls.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I knew it was right around here.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Me and my friends sneak in on the weekends. We hang around, pick up on the babes, drink some wine, get wasted on killer hash--

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be smoking either.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Thanks, Grandpa, but I've been smoking for four harvests, so I think I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 38 Zed, Oh and Isaac gape at the high masonry walls as they approach the massive solid wooden gates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Gee, they're not open. We should probably come back later.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: You just have to knock. They always let me in. (to Oh) Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Me? Why do I have to knock? What if we're waking somebody up? Let's just get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Where? Back to the penis-cutter? Besides, Eema and Maya might be in there. You want to get them out before the city's destroyed, don't you? Isaac impatiently grabs a big rock and starts banging on door.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (SHOUTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Anybody there? Hello? Suddenly Zed and Oh are yanked off their feet from behind slammed into the wall by helmeted sentries. Isaac quickly runs away.

dialogues.speaker: SENTRY
dialogues.text: (shouts at him) Halt! Isaac stops a safe distance away and turns back to taunt guards.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: You gonna make me? (dancing and dodging like a boxer) You and what army?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (shouts to Isaac) Get help! Tell your father!

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (shouts back) Yeah! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Like I'm really gonna tell my father I came with you to Sodom. So long, suckers! He takes off running.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (to Oh) I kinda get why his dad wanted to kill him. The sentries drag them through a small door cut into a co of the city gates.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 39 The sentries shove them into a small guard post and throw them up against the wall. THREE OTHER GUARDS look up at t new arrivals.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GUARD
dialogues.text: What's this now?

dialogues.speaker: SENTRY
dialogues.text: They were banging on the gate. Hebrews, from the look of them.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: We're not really Hebrews-- The guard smacks him in the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Okay. Lesson learned. No talking.

dialogues.speaker: SENTRY
dialogues.text: Should we wake the Sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: FIRST GUARD
dialogues.text: You don't want to do that. He gets pretty mean when you wake him.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Meaner than this? The sentry grabs Oh's nipple and twists. Oh SCREAMS loudl The guards freeze at the sound of his scream and look nervously to a closed door at one end of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: (from behind the door,

dialogues.speaker: THERE
dialogues.text: Zed and Oh exchange worried looks. Then the door flies op and the SERGEANT, a huge, angry, sadistic rhino of a man, fills the door frame.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Who the hell screamed? They all point at Oh.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: (glowers at him) I thought it was a woman. He lumbers over and gets his face very close to Oh's.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: You don't look like a woman, but maybe you want to kiss me anyway. Is that right? You want to kiss me? Oh turns away from his foul breath. The sergeant grabs Oh by the throat and practically lifts off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: By morning you'll be sorry you were born.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Don't have to wait 'til morning.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Hey! Why don't you pick on someone your own size? The sergeant drops Oh and turns to Zed.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (quickly backpedaling) Which would be difficult since there are probably very few people around who actually are your size-- He smacks Zed hard on the side of the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: (to another guard) Get my big stick. I'll deal with the fat one first.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (INSULTED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relatively fat one. I wouldn't be talking about fat, if I were you. Another blow from the sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Right. Enough said. The sergeant rips open Zed's shirt exposing his back, the steps up behind Oh and does the same. A guard hands him a lethal-looking bat studded with sharp spikes.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: (to Zed and Oh) Welcome to Sodom. As he takes a big backswing, Zed and Oh shut their eyes a prepare for the worst.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Stop! Zed and Oh turn to see Cain at the door, dressed like the other guards in breastplate and helmet.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Wait! I know these guys!

dialogues.speaker: ZED AND OH
dialogues.text: Cain?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Brothers!! He embraces them. They look confused and doubtful, but relieved.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 40 Cain leads them through the narrow crowded streets. Peopl avoid Cain's gaze and part like the Red Sea to allow him through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: You know, you guys are lucky that sergeant is a friend of mine. I let him sodomize me once right after I got here and he's been real nice to me ever since.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (SARCASTIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, thanks for saving us. What are you going to do to us now? Cain stops and looks at them.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: wait a second. Do I detect a tone here?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: All right, honestly? You did sell us into slavery.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (instantly offended) Whoa whoa whoa! Hold a grudge much? That was like a fortnight ago.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: That was way less than a fortnight. Half a fortnight, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Give me a break! I was dealing with the death of a close family member and I needed some space. But now I realize that you guys are like my brothers. And it's so rare to find a brother that you love. Right? He embraces them.

dialogues.speaker: ZED AND OH
dialogues.text: (UNEASILY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (EXUBERANT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, you guys hungry? Watch this. Cain walks up to a food vendor's stall and stares menacin at the VENDOR. He raises his fist. The vendor cowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (to Vendor) That's two for flinching. Cain grabs two lamb kebabs and hands them to Zed and Oh.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: That's the kind of love I'm talkin' about. As they eat hungrily, Zed makes eye contact with a prosti lounging in a doorway.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Check out that woman across the street! She's looking at us. The prostitute smiles at them as she sensuously peels a banana, then slides the whole thing unbroken into her mou

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: We are so in! She's eye-knowing us like crazy.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: You're gonna love Sodom. Trust me. It's crazy. This morning, I almost got a handie behind that pita stand.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Well, I kind of have a girlfriend-- not a girlfriend, yet, but a girl I like, so I shouldn't--

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Hey, what happens in Sodom, stays in Sodom. He takes a jug of wine from the stall of a WINE MERCHANT. The merchant just bows obsequiously and keeps his mouth s

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: You know, if you guys are staying you should join the guards. The pay's not great, but there's tons of perks. I'm telling you, it's the only way to go. Cain grabs a piece of candy from a SMALL CHILD and stuffs in his mouth. The child starts crying, Cain kicks her in ass and she runs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (to the child) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Come on, I'll introduce you to the captain.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 41 A military drum roll and the blare of trumpets rouse the garrison. GUARDSMEN come double-timing out of the barrack and hurry to line up in formation. Last to emerge are Zed and Oh who step leisurely out the now dressed as Royal Guards. Zed actually looks dashing, Oh's breastplate is too big and his helmet keeps slipping down over his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: This is great! How do I look?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: You look good, but I think my hat's too big. They notice an OFFICER staring at them.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (to the officer) Do you happen to know where I could get a smaller hat? The officer pops him on the head with a truncheon.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: (ROARS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Line up! Zed and Oh hustle into line, orders are shouted and the t marches off.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: 42 Zed and Oh are on patrol with Cain in the heart of the ci

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: So is this it? We just walk around?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Pretty much. We just look for troublemakers and kick the living shit out of 'em.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: What kind of trouble?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: If we see a thief or a pickpocket, we just slap him around-- maybe cut off a finger or an ear, or the tip of his nose, lower lip-- anything you can just grab and slice in one fluid motion-- then we take our share of the loot and let him go.
