Mostly what we worry about are activist types, rabble rousers, getting people all riled up against the King or the Temple Priests. That's death for sure.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Pretty harsh, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Harsh times, brother. We're in the middle of a famine. People are starving. If we don't get some rain soon, it could get ugly. (looking forward to it) Then we'll get to start kicking ass big time. He stops to flog a BEGGAR with his hand out. CAIN                                           (cont'd) Beat it, you filthy beggar!

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: You can't blame people for being hungry.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, just remember, it's the palace that pays you, not the people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White Suddenly, they hear a regal fanfare of approaching trumpe and turn to look. At the sound of the trumpets EVERYONE IN THE CROWDED SQUA falls to the ground and prostrates himself. Cain pulls Oh the ground but Zed is left standing there oblivious as th ROYAL ENTOURAGE approaches. Oh taps on Zed's leg trying to get his attention, but Zed just ignores it, too transfixed to notice that he's the o one standing. EIGHT STRONG MALE SLAVES enter the square carrying an ornately decorated litter shaded with a silk canopy. On i is the PRINCESS INANNA, a stunning young woman, richly dressed and bejeweled, with exotic eyes and luscious red lips. A HANDMAIDEN rides along fanning her with a big ostrich plume fan. Zed sees the Princess and is instantly taken with her bea Princess Inanna glances his way and can't help but notice he's the only person in the square still standing. She gi him a quizzical smile, then turns away imperiously. As the litter passes, her handmaiden continues to stare a Zed. He doesn't recognize her, but we do. It's Maya, now elaborately costumed and made-up. Zed gawks at the Princess, then suddenly a ROYAL GUARD kn him to the ground and stands on his neck as the rest of t entourage passes.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (on the ground, excitedly to Oh) Did you see that girl? I think she liked me! She looked right at me.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Gee, I wonder why? The royal guard takes his foot off Zed's neck and they al get back to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Who was she?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: The Princess Inanna. She's totally hot, but don't even think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Because she's royalty and you're scum? The entire crowd starts moving in the same direction as t royal entourage.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Where's everybody going?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: To the temple. Let's go. (starts walking) You have to see this.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (FOLLOWING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will she be there?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Everybody will be there.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 43 At the center of the square is a magnificent temple adorn with elaborate carvings and monumental statues of pagan g Before it is a great altar in front of a HUGE STONE IDOL. The idol's mouth is a gaping fiery furnace. Behind the temple, is a towering ZIGGURAT still under construction. A HUNDRED TRUMPETERS AND DRUMMERS blast a solemn fanfare ORNATELY GARBED PRIESTS ceremoniously climb the stairs to altar.

dialogues.speaker: ZED AND OH
dialogues.text: stare at the spectacle. 44 The Princess Inanna takes her seat near the KING, the QUE the MINISTERS and other NOBLES. Maya stands behind the Princess and continues fanning her. Zed spots the Princess on the pavilion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official white

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Hey, there she is! He starts edging toward the royal pavilion. 45 45 Under a broad awning, the King and Queen snack from a tab covered with platters of exotic fruits and sweetmeats. The King, an imposing man with Shakespearean gravity, wip his mouth and glances at the Princess Inanna.

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: The Princess isn't eating?

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: I find it hard to eat when so many are hungry.

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: (as if ) Your concern is enviable.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: (POUTY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And besides, I'm so fat. The Queen,

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: (for the hundredth time) You're not fat--

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: Yes, I am, mother! Those new linen pants you got me from Egypt make my ass look just huge.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: Well, you can't keep starving yourself.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: Why not? Everybody else is starving-- present company excluded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: Careful, Princess. You may be my step-daughter, but these are dangerous times and those are dangerous words. I weep for the suffering of my people, but the spirit of rebellion is alive in the city and if necessary I will crush it with every means at my disposal.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: (SARCASTIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the good of the people.

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: (warning her) For the good of everyone who enjoys the favor of the throne.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: Whatever. I'm just so incredibly bored. 46 The fanfare climaxes as the great temple doors slowly ope and the HIGH PRIEST emerges followed by a retinue of PRIESTESSES and a dozen VESTAL VIRGINS. They walk in sole silence to ritual positions around the altar. The High Priest is even more elaborately costumed than th nobles, ridiculously so, standing very tall on high platf shoes, with heavy eye makeup, his hair and beard even oil than the others. He turns to the altar, raises his hands the heavens and begins his invocation.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: (intoning pompously) O El, lord of Heaven and Earth; Baal, the Sublime; Shapash, goddess of the sun; Hadad, the storm god, over-ruling son of Dagon, the bountiful, god of grain, our earthly sustenance--

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: He makes his way to a position just below the royal pavil and stares up at the Princess Inanna. She sees him looking at her but pretends not to notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official white

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: Isn't that the idiot who was standing up in the street? Maya sees him, too, and starts fuming. The High Priest continues.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: We come before you in humble supplication, invoking your blessing, the sweet rain which waters our fields, enriches the harvest, fills our storehouses, makes mighty the house of Ish-ka-bi- baal and the city of Sodom-- The King nods graciously.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: --and feeds us, your children, with the bounty of your grace.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS INANNA
dialogues.text: She glances at Zed again, but this time a slight smile crosses her lips. Zed grins back at her. The Princess whispers something to her handmaiden Maya an subtly points Zed out to her. Maya nods obediently, glari at Zed, and starts fanning the princess a little too vigorously.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: Accept now this humble sacrifice to the power and glory of your magnificence. He starts inspecting the Vestal Virgins, beautiful young women in diaphanous, almost transparent white gowns.

dialogues.speaker: ZED AND OH
dialogues.text: have no idea what's going on. Zed turns to the GUY NEXT T HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: He's picking a virgin.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (LASCIVIOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Uh huh. Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE ALTAR
dialogues.text: the High Priest is moving down the line of beautiful youn maidens. He comes to one SLUTTY GIRL who seems so obvious not a virgin, he does a double take and kicks her out of line.

dialogues.speaker: ZED AND OH
dialogues.text: watching curiously.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: What do they want a virgin for?

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: To throw into the fire.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (SHOCKED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: (like talking to an idiot) Offering to the Gods. There's a famine going on. If we don't make a good sacrifice, it won't rain. No rain, no harvest. No harvest, no food. Get it?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: It's pretty self-explanatory.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: You throw the virgin in the fire so it'll rain?

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Duh.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Seems like a waste of a perfectly good virgin to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official white

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (CONCERNED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These virgins-- it's always a girl, right?

dialogues.speaker: AT THE ALTAR
dialogues.text: A great cheer goes up as a girl is chosen. She swoons as priestesses slip off her vestment and two priests escort to the fiery mouth of the furnace.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: For the love of the Gods and the glory of their Creation, the great dome of Heaven, the green growing Earth, we commit this maiden to your Holy Fire. Another great cheer from the crowd as they throw her into fire.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (APPALLED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is just crazy. Maya approaches them but Zed and Oh still don't recognize her.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (eyes downcast) The Princess wishes to see you.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (staring at her cleavage) Her wish is my command.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Not you. Him. (points at Zed)

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Me? Cool. (then, motioning to Oh) We're kind of a package deal. Can he come with?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: The three of us are inseparable. We're like brothers. Cain squeezes both their shoulders and gives Maya an artificial smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White Maya ignores Cain and points to Zed and Oh.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: The two of you follow me.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (to Cain) I'll try to put in a good word for you. Cain fumes as Zed and Oh head off with Maya.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 47 47 A SQUAD OF SENTRIES stands guard at the massive iron pala gates. A CROWD OF BEGGARS is pressed against the gate pleading for food. Zed and Oh approach led by Maya. The guards brutally push the beggars aside and they enter. 48 48 Maya leads Zed and Oh through the gate and into a beautif atrium where they are met by a fat bald EUNUCH wearing th royal livery.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (to Oh) This is Zaftig the Eunuch. You go with him. Oh is led away by the Eunuch as she takes Zed off in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Can't I go with him?

dialogues.speaker: EUNUCH
dialogues.text: Why? Is he your lover?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (laughs at the thought) Hah! No? That would be weird.

dialogues.speaker: LOVERS--
dialogues.text: The Eunuch just shrugs, apparently not that weird to him.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (COVERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: EUNUCH
dialogues.text: I serve the royal family-- little of this, little of that. I've been a palace eunuch since I was nine years old.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: You've been living here since you were nine? (looks around, impressed) I should look into that. How do you get to be a eunuch?

dialogues.speaker: EUNUCH
dialogues.text: (MATTER-OF-FACT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cut off your testicles.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (HORRIFIED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! What's up with all the genital mutilation?

dialogues.speaker: EUNUCH
dialogues.text: (SHRUGS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, after a while you don't even miss them.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (EMPHATIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'd miss them-- I'm sure. I hardly got to use them yet. The Eunuch leads him down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 49 land with a wet splat on a polished marble table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The High Priest, an extremely vain, officious, and fussy still over-dressed in sacramental drag, pushes back his sleeves and starts examining the entrails as the King and MINISTERS look on, deeply concerned.

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: Six sacrifices in the last ten days and still no rain. What do the entrails predict?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: (nervously poking at the sheep heart) Well, the liver is streaked with gray-- that's not a favorable sign-- but the heart looks good. See how nice and red it is here. That's always a good omen.

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: What does it mean?

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: Usually it means that the sheep took very good care of itself, probably sticking to a high-fiber diet of grass and hay.

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: What does it mean for us?

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: Well, it could mean either a surprise visit from a former friend or sweetheart-- or that you're going on a long sea voyage! Wouldn't that be fun?

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: (SCORNFUL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you become High Priest?

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: Because I'm your brother?

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: Perhaps it's time for a new High Priest.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: (his eyes go wide) Perhaps it's not time for a new High Priest. Aaaahh! He dramatically flings his fingers out at the Prime Minis as if wielding the power of the Gods. Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: And let that be a warning to you. Next time, I will hurl a lightning bolt at your face. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: (CONSIDERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or a fire-ball.

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: (ignores him) Majesty, there's talk of revolution in the streets. Grain and oil are scarce, prices are high, starving peasants are pouring into the city looking for food--

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: Poverty has a bitter taste, but it's the flavor they were born to. It's the will of the Gods. The Queen and Princess Inanna are lounging on cushioned divans, listening.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: (BLASE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can the Gods really be so cruel?

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: I don't think that's cruel. It's just practical. If everybody was rich, who'd wait on us? Maya approaches and whispers something to the Princess.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: Good. See that he's bathed and dressed, then bring him to me. Maya frowns and exits. INANNA (cont'd) (to the queen) This should be amusing.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 50 Maya leads Zed down a grand hallway. Zed is now wearing a long flowing robe of silk brocade, fine sandals, and jewe His hair has been combed and pulled back into a loose ponytail. He stops to admire himself in a mirror.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: What do you think, ponytail or no ponytail? You know what? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I'll start with the ponytail, see where the night takes me. Maya rolls her eyes and leads Zed to the entrance of the Great Hall. Cain and another guard are posted at the door

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Hey, you made it! What's it like inside?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (POINTED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't know.- I'm just a guard because my "brother" didn't pull any strings with his friends in the royal court.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Look, first of all, we're not actually brothers---

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Just like Abel. I oughta just bash your head in--

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Hey! You didn't let me finish. As soon as I get in there I'm going to talk to somebody and get you invited, okay?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (UNCONVINCED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. Have a nice orgy. Cain pulls open the big doors and Zed steps through the portal. Cain tries to steal peeks inside as the heavy doo slam shut.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 51 A full-scale ORGY is going on in a magnificent hall. As Maya leads him into the room, Zed pulls his hair out o the ponytail.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Feels like a hair-down kinda scene, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: As you wish. (POINTEDLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be sure to try the fruit. Zed looks at her and finally recognizes her.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Maya?! What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I had no choice. I'm a slave, remember?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I was going to rescue you! Really! In fact, we came here to find you.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (not buying it) Wait here until you're sent for.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: This wasn't my idea, you know.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Of course not. You were just chosen again. Maybe after you and the Princess get together you can start thinking about someone beside yourself. She walks off before he can answer. Zed shakes his head, looks around the room, then STARTS walking past a row of "LIVING STATUES," semi-nude men and women on pedestals covered head to toe in gold body paint frozen in heroic postures that show off their beautiful bodies. Zed looks closely at one beautiful nude "GODDESS", then furtively reaches out and fondles her breast. The goddess slaps his hand, then resumes her pose.

dialogues.speaker: GODDESS
dialogues.text: watch it, jerk!

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Hey! You're a real girl! That is so cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White He moves down the row of living sculptures, mugging at th mock humping, and waving his hands in their faces trying make them move, but they remain frozen.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Amazing! He comes to the LAST STATUE and does a double-take. This is wearing only a skimpy cloth diaper and is posed like someone waiting for a bus. He is also painted gold, but unlike the others, he has a little potbelly and round shoulders, and can't seem to hold still for very long, shifting his weight uncomfortably and looking around in obvious embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (recognizing him) Oh? Oh looks down from his pedestal.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (through clenched teeth) I'm not supposed to talk. I'm a statue.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Yeah, you look so-- gold. How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: How's it going? I just had my whole body painted by a fat guy with no balls, and believe me, he was very thorough, if you know what I mean. How's it going with you?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Not bad. Had a little rub and a scrub, now I'm up for some grub.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: That sounds nice-- for you.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Hey! You'll never guess who's here- - Maya! She's working here-- and she looks great! But she's kinda mad at me. Oh scans the great hall looking for her and spots Zed's sister Eema, his crush, come into the room carrying a tra food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: There's Eema! Eema has been beautifully groomed and is now dressed as a household slave. She stops to serve some rowdy OFFICERS w take the opportunity to tease and fondle her. She tries t pull away but Sargon, the general, grabs her arm.

dialogues.speaker: SARGON
dialogues.text: Stand still, wench! I want to see what's under that skirt. As he starts to lift her hem, she drops the whole tray of food on him. His cohorts laugh.

dialogues.speaker: EEMA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry! It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: SARGON
dialogues.text: That was no accident! Sargon grabs her and raises his hand to hit her. Zed steps in quickly.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: You! Slave girl! (he pulls her away from

dialogues.speaker: SARGON
dialogues.text: I told you to fetch me more wine! Apologize to this officer--- now!

dialogues.speaker: EEMA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Now go-- fetch! Wait by that-- skinny statue. I'll deal with you later. As Eema exits, Zed turns to the officers and shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Slaves-- what are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: SARGON
dialogues.text: Try using a hot poker. That they understand.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Ouch. Helpful hint. I will keep that in mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White Zed bows, then leaves him and joins Eema who is waiting a Oh's pedestal. Zed What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: EEMA
dialogues.text: We were sold to the palace. But I won't serve these people! I'd rather die!

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Keep that up and you will.

dialogues.speaker: EEMA
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? (notices his clothes) Have you joined them?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: I haven't joined anything. (re the gold body paint) Does this look like fun? They both look accusingly at Zed.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Okay, I know what you're thinking, but I'm just checking it out. We kept hearing that this place was so evil, but now that I look around I'm thinking maybe it's not all bad. There's a lot to learn here.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: What? Like human sacrifice?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: No! Like the wheel, for instance! That's pretty awesome-- the way it just goes around in a circle. And farming! And metal-- writing, money, pottery-- hot baths. Come on! Back in the village we thought sharpening a stick was a big breakthrough.

dialogues.speaker: EEMA
dialogues.text: (to Oh) What happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Look, I think I've been chosen to do something great with my life--

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Here we go again--

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: --and I don't think it's hunting wild pigs and weaving baskets. Maya returns for Zed.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (COOLLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to see you-- now.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I hope you don't think I'm interested in her.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (MIFFED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I think that? Just because you couldn't take your eyes off her--

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I'm just using her, Maya! It's part of my plan. I'm going to get you all out of here as soon as I can.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (SKEPTICAL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your plan?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (not a clue) It's a secret.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (not buying it) Forget it. Maya sees A GUARD watching them and reverts to her slave attitude. MAYA (cont'd) (bowing to Zed) The Princess awaits you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: And I await her. (to Oh and Eema) You two await me. (then confidentially to Eema and Oh) Stay out of trouble. I'll be back. He exits with Maya.

dialogues.speaker: EEMA
dialogues.text: He has no idea what he's doing, does he?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: I don't know. So much has happened. Sometimes I think-- She walks away.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (wistfully, to himself) I love you. 52 Lounging on a divan surrounded by YOUNG MEN. Oh walks by still painted gold.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: (to Oh) You there! Golden boy! Rub me with oil. The High Priest dismisses the young men, then stands and his rich outer robe fall to the floor. His chest, back an shoulders are incredibly hairy.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: I'd rather not, if you don't mind. I'm not really a slave. I'm a guard.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: Then maybe you'd rather I speak to your commander and have you whipped to within an inch of your life. Or perhaps I whip you myself? How would you like that?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Are those my choices?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: I'd say so. The High Priest lies back down. Oh looks around, finds a pitcher filled with precious oil and dribbles some on the High Priest's hairy chest.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: More.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (splashes a few more drops on him) That enough?

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: (getting angry) No! More oil! Much more, you insolent dolt! Oh pours oil liberally over his chest, back, and shoulder

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: That's good. Now rub it in.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (APPALLED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With my hands?

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: Do it! Oh grimaces and starts gingerly massaging the oil into hi hairy chest and shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: (in ecstasy) Mmmmm, I love it. The sweet scent of precious oil. The oily-- oiliness. Eema walks by with a pitcher of wine and sees Oh massagin the High Priest. She gasps.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (EMBARRASSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eema! This isn't what you think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: EEMA
dialogues.text: (FLUSTERED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's fine. I understand. This really explains a lot about you that I didn't get before.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: No, really! I'm just-- rubbing oil on this man. She exits.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: Mnum imam. I have an idea. Why don't we go back to my place and see what's under all that paint?

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (DISGUSTED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ughh.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 53 Maya ushers Zed into the dimly lit room.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA--
dialogues.text: She leaves him. A haze of heavily scented incense hangs i the air.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Come to me. Zed turns and sees the Princess standing on the terrace. 54 Zed steps out onto the moonlit terrace. He crosses to the balustrade and stands beside the Princess, gazing out ove the twinkling cityscape.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: Beautiful, isn't it? You can see Gomorrah just over the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White                                   91.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I didn't know it was so close.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: They're called the "twin cities."

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Looks pretty from up here, but some people think God is going to wipe them out because they're so evil.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: (toying with him) And what do you think? Am I evil?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I don't really know you. But you don't look evil.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCESS
dialogues.text: Do you find me attractive?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Well, yeah. I think you're-- incredible.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: (moving closer) I have body issues.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: No, you're perfect. Your face, your hair-- (looking into her eyes) Your eyes are like the sea.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: (a beat) My eyes are brown.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Well, it's kinda dark. I took a shot. I know they're big, though-- and wet-- She pulls him close. ZED                                   (cont'd) Can I ask you one thing? What would a girl like you want with a guy like me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official white

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: I don't know. I just find you-- interesting. They say it's the will of the gods that some men should suffer while others rule-- that we're all just victims of our fate. And I believed that until this morning when I saw you standing up, alone, in the square. And I said to myself, finally here's one man who refuses to bow down to anything--

dialogues.speaker: UH--
dialogues.text: (considers explaining but just lets it go) Yeah. That's me.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: Yes, finally a man who has the courage to question the order of things--- a man chosen by the Gods to do something great.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (EXHILARATED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's exactly what I've been thinking! You wouldn't believe the things that have been happening to me lately. I just didn't know why.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: (gets very, very close) I know why. To bring you here-- to this place-- to me.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (SMITTEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't agree more. I'm trying to agree more, but I can't. That's how much I agree.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: Come. She takes his hand and leads him away. A SHADOWY FIGURE watches them from behind a curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White 55 55 We can see torchlight flickering inside the temple and TW FIGURES moving among the pillars. 56 The High Priest is giving Oh a personal tour of the inner sanctum. Oh is scrubbed and dressed like a junior priest.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: My life is devoted to the service of the Gods and the good of the people. I take nothing for myself. He has a huge gold ring set with precious gems on every finger, and a gold tiara on his head studded with rubies emeralds.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: That's so-- unselfish of you.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: Yes, it is. It's just so-- lonely. Sometimes i hunger for the touch of another human being. (COY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a riddle: what has two thumbs and wants another oil rub? (pointing thumbs at

dialogues.speaker: HIMSELF
dialogues.text: This-guy. Ohquickly changes the subject.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: So where does that hall lead to?

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: (his eyes light up) Come, I'll show you. He takes Oh's arm and leads him down the hail toward a se incredibly impressive doors covered with cuneiform writin and arcane religious symbols.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: Behind those doors is the Holy of Holies-- the earthly domain of the (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White HIGH PRIEST                           (cont'd) Gods-- a place so ineffably sacred, so powerful, that to enter is instant death for any mortal.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Wow. (a long beat) So who cleans it?

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: it needs no cleaning.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: No, of course not. (can't let go of it) Kind of makes you wonder though-- the guys who built it, did they just die the minute they finished, or did the Gods give them a second to get out?

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: (starting to get annoyed) I assume they finished it, then the Gods descended.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's probably it. (another long beat) So you're saying we can't go in?

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: I just told you! To enter is instant death! Only I can go in and only once a year after very elaborate purification rituals and days of special prayers and offerings.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (QUICKLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, right, right. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we just open the doors and stick our heads in?

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: Fine! Enough! I'm sorry I brought it up. Let's go. (pushes Oh along) Move. Move. He shoos him down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White 57

dialogues.speaker: IN
dialogues.text: Zed and Princess Inanna stealthily enter the temple.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (looking around nervously) What are we doing here?

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: I want you to enter the Holy of Holies.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Yes! Finally. Now you're talking! Should I enter it right here or should we go back to your bedroom? Does the Holy of Holies like to be entered from behind or--?

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: (POINTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the Holy of Holies-- you have to go in there and talk to the Gods.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: The Gods are in there?

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: So they say, but the only one who ever goes in is the High Priest. They say it's instant death for anyone else to enter.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Then why am I going in?

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: (IMPATIENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you were chosen? If the Gods wanted you dead they would have killed you already.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: This is what you've been chosen for! To speak to the Gods and plead with them not to destroy the city. Then come back out and tell me what it's like inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (mulling it over) Right-- right. Then again, if the rules say--

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: Do you always follow the rules?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: What is it with chicks always wanting guys to break the rules? You-all have this bad boy complex---- She kisses him fiercely on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: Do this for me.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I'm going in. He enters the Holy of Holies. A FIGURE darts between the columns and hides in the shadows. A beam of moonlight reveals the mark of Cain on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 58 Zed steps into the chamber and immediately prostrates himself, face down on the floor, arms outstretched in supplication. He lies there with his eyes tightly shut, expecting to be vaporized any second. A long moment passe in total silence. Then he opens his eyes and looks around tentatively. The inner chamber of the Holy of Holies is a bare room wi marble walls lit only by shafts of moonlight from skyligh above.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (takes a deep breath and starts improvising) Thank you, O-- Merciful ones, for-- not like-- killing me, and letting me receive the, uh, blessing of your holy-- godliness. He exhales and closes his eyes again, waiting for some di response. Nothing comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White ZED                                               (cont'd (props himself up on his

dialogues.speaker: ELBOWS
dialogues.text: Okay, I don't know the right words-- so I'm just going to say what I have to say-- if that's all right. (waits for a response, gets none, proceeds) I know I haven't always done the right thing. Eating the fruit was bad, I know that-- and the Cain thing-- and I have done somethings with women-- I do love the ladies-- well, you probably know all that because you're watching everything-- (a thought occurs) Do you really watch everything? That's got to be a little disgusting sometimes-- but probably pretty hot, too-- (QUICKLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that you would get off on any of it-- okay, I'm getting off the subject. Anyways, the word is you've been considering destroying this place. So I'm asking you not to-- as a personal favor. (NOTHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel free to jump in anytime. I could use a little guidance here. Still no response. He rolls over onto his back. ZED                                               (cont'd Look, I know you think this place is evil and it kinda is-- I see that-- but that's not everybody. There are a lot of good people, too. So what if there were, like, fifty really good people? Would you still destroy the city? (SILENCE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you're right, that may be a reach. How about twenty? I could probably get you twenty extremely good people if I really looked around. (SILENCE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about five? Five awesome people-- including myself. I personally know at least five people worth saving. Does that sound good? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (NOTHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? A little help? Am I getting warm here? Okay, is it me? Are you punishing me for stuff I did? (an insight) Or setting me up for what I need to do. Or both! Or neither? (NOTHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you give me some kind of a sign-- please-- anything? Zed listens but hears only a profound silence. Then a revelation. He sits up on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Okay, wait. Is that the sign? The silence? Is that it? (waits for confirmation) It is, isn't it! Just this really silent-- silence. (PONDERING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to tell me what to do; it's up to me to decide what's right and what's wrong-- right? Is that it? You're not going to speak to me-- you're going to speak through me? If that's right, don't say anything. (listens for a beat) Okay, I read you loud and clear. Thank you. (an afterthought) Oh, and if things don't work out with Maya would it be okay with you if me and the Princess had a little "carnal knowledge"? Not in an evil way or anything-- (he listens; silence) Okay! You're right, probably not a good idea. Thank you. He backs out of the Holy of Holies, bowing all the way.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 59 59 The doors to the Holy of Holies opens and Zed comes backi out, still bowing and muttering. Then he turns and his fa falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White The High Priest, the King, the Queen, and a dozen Temple Acolytes are staring at him in amazement. Oh stands besid the High Priest dressed just like him.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I was just looking for the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: (INNOCENTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him not to go in.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: (SHRIEKS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seize them!

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (scared, points at Zed) Seize him! The guards arrest Oh as Cain steps up and takes hold of Z

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (SMIRKING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should've invited me to the party.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 60 60 In the dim torchlight, we see Zed hanging spread-eagle fi feet off the ground, his arms and legs stretched out wide tightly bound to iron rings imbedded in the stone. Oh is shackled to the wall beside him, hanging upside dow They hear the faint scream of a man being tortured somewh deep in the prison.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I wish I was upside down. Looks fun. Oh won't talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: So this is it? We're not friends anymore? After all I've done for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: What have you done for me? I've been attacked by a cougar, I've fallen down a mountain, I almost had the tip of my thingy cut off, I've been greasing up the High Priest all night, and now I'm hanging upside down in a dungeon. And I have to pee real bad. All because of you. You call yourself a friend? Name one good thing you've done for me.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I've helped you come out of your shell.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (in distress) I really have to pee--

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Listen, I know I'm not perfect, and I may have made a few wrong turns, but you have to understand-- I'm a chosen. That's a lot of responsibility -- you can't even imagine.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (ANGRY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only one who thinks you're chosen is you, so shut up already!

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (STUNG)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, be mad, but I'm going to get us out of here, if it's the last thing I do. Zed starts frantically yanking on his shackles to no avai

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: That was just my first idea-- and I'm also accepting ideas.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (SHOUTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guard! I have to pee! Now! Seriously! (can't hold it anymore) Oh, no--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White Because he's upside down, the streams runs down his stoma over his chest, down his neck, onto his chin and over his face.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: I hate you.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 61 61 A curious, jeering MOB is gathering as Zed and Oh, in shackles, are led by a SQUAD OF GUARDS to a raised platfo in the middle of the square. The heavy pounding of martial drums silences the crowd. C presides over the execution. He addresses the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: For the crimes of blasphemy-- (the crowd grumbles its

dialogues.speaker: HERESY--
dialogues.text: (grumble, grumble)

dialogues.speaker: CONSPIRACY--
dialogues.text: (serious grumbling)

dialogues.speaker: SODOMY--
dialogues.text: (admiring oohs and aahs) And the murder of my brother Abel--

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Oh, come on!

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Shut up! For these and other crimes they may not actually have done yet but we're pretty sure they were thinking about, the prisoners will be stoned to death. The crowd roars as GUARDS stationed around the square pul canvas covers off big baskets of rocks and the people rus grab stones to throw. Zed and Oh instinctively move closer to each other.

dialogues.speaker: PALACE BALCONY
dialogues.text: The King, Queen, High Priest and Royal Ministers observe stoning from their vantage point above the square. Prince Inanna refuses to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: Observe, my dear. It seems the least you could do, since it was you who lured him to his death. She reluctantly turns and looks at Zed.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: I didn't intend for this to happen.

dialogues.speaker: THE SQUARE
dialogues.text: The people move in and surround the platform on all sides baseball-size rocks in their hands.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (to Zed and Oh) Anything to say before the sentence is carried out?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (to the crowd) I just want to say this is really messed up--

dialogues.speaker: OKAY--
dialogues.text: (SHOUTS)

dialogues.speaker: STONE THEM
dialogues.text: The people fling their rocks with all their might. Zed and Oh duck. The rocks fly over their heads and hit people in the crow the opposite sides, several bystanders taking painful hit the head, some falling down unconscious. Cain notes the impracticality of having people throw rock from all directions.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Okay! Stop! Halt! Hold it! This isn't working.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Can I make a suggestion?

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (IRKED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Why don't you just pick one person to throw? The crowd thinks that's not a bad idea and murmurs agreem

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (pressing the advantage) In fact, don't you think it would be fair for us to get to pick the person who stones us? Cain looks doubtful, but the crowd thinks this is eminent fair.

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: (some eagerly raising their hands and waving like school children) Yes! Ooh, me! Pick me! Me!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BALCONY
dialogues.text: The King grabs Sargon.

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: (re Cain) What is that idiot doing?

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SQUARE
dialogues.text: Zed spots a good candidate in the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: We pick him! Cain points at a BIG GUY, heavily muscled, eagerly waving hand.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Him?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: No, next to him! He points at a BOY, about nine years old and not very big

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: He's just a kid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: So? You got something against kids? Zed plays the crowd which starts booing in disapproval.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: This guy hates kids!

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: Yeah! What's he got against kids? Children are the future! Give the kid a shot! The kid! The kid! On the balcony, the King shifts uncomfortably, intimidate the power of the mob. He nods to Sargon who signals to Ca

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: All right! All right! We'll try it. Kid! Grab a rock. The boy picks up a good-size rock. Zed turns to Oh.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Good thinking, huh? They turn to face the boy, ready to dodge when he throws. The boy winds up and fires a major league fastball that smacks Oh right on the forehead. The crowd cheers.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Holy shit! That kid's got an arm!

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (DAZED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he hit me. The boy fires again. Oh spins and tries to duck but takes the rock right on th head.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Hey! There's two of us! The crowd cheers and pats the kid on the back.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Okay, everybody on this side now! On the count of three! One-- two--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official white

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Wait! I have a question for the King! The crowd goes silent. All eyes turn and look up to the palace balcony.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (shouts to the King) Why didn't I die in the Holy of Holies? On the balcony, everyone is totally stopped by his questi One by one they all look to the High Priest who seems to stumped. In the square, the crowd starts muttering. Zed seizes the initiative.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I entered the Holy of Holies and, lo, I did not die! Why? Because I am chosen by the Gods!

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE IN THE CROWD
dialogues.text: He is chosen! He is the Chosen One. The Chosen One! Zed gives Oh a look: "See? I told you."

dialogues.speaker: THE CROWD
dialogues.text: (starts chanting) Spare the Chosen One! Spare the Chosen One! Spare the Chosen One!

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: And his friend! Don't forget his friend! On the balcony, the King and his ministers hastily confer with the High Priest.

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: Could it be? Is he truly chosen?

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: I don't-- I suppose it's possible- I'd have to examine some new

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: Imbecile!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: PRIME MINISTER
dialogues.text: Majesty, with respect, whether he's chosen or not is no longer the issue. To kill him now, given the public mood, could inflame the situation enough to prompt a radical "regime change," if you take my meaning. The King looks grimly at his ministers, all of whom have and hungry looks. Princess Inanna smiles contemptuously at him.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 62 62 addressing the crowd in the square.

dialogues.speaker: SARGON
dialogues.text: By order of the King, the sentence has been commuted. The crowd cheers. Zed and Oh exchange hopeful looks.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (PLAINTIVE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we just stone them a little?

dialogues.speaker: SARGON
dialogues.text: It is the judgement of our most merciful King that the prisoners are to be enslaved to toil at hard labor until they die of exhaustion or starvation.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (exuberant fist pump) Yes!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 63 Oh is up to his knees in a mud pit, trampling straw into thick mud. A Guard cracks a bullwhip which flicks painful across his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official white

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Okay, you think that actually makes anybody work harder? It just makes them resent you. Is that what you want?

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: (whips him again) Faster!

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Can I just ask when lunch is? The whip lashes out again. Oh glowers at him and steps up the pace. 64 Marlak and Enmebaragesi are stacking bricks when zed approaches.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (greets them) Hey! Boys! Long time no see. They glance up, but ignore him.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Don't tell me you're still mad about Maya. That's so over. I have a thing going with the princess now-- well, almost had a thing. I'm a slave now-- just like you.

dialogues.speaker: MARLAK
dialogues.text: No. You're not just like me.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Okay. We do have our differences-- like about a cup and half of brain tissue-- but that doesn't mean we can't work together. Another GUARD approaches and whacks Marlak with his stick

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Take those bricks to the top. The masons are waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official white Marlak and Enmebaragesi glower at the guard as they pick ropes and harness themselves to a cart loaded with bricks

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: (to Zed) You! Help them! He grabs another rope harness off the cart and throws it Zed.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: You know, I'd like to, but I did something to my neck-- (massages his neck) I must've slept on it funny-- those dungeon pillows are like rocks-- well, they are rocks-- so I should probably take it easy or I'll be no damn good for work tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: (strikes him across the back with his stick) I said move!

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Okay! But I should tell you, this isn't really my area. I'm just on a break from the mud department-- The Guard draws his short sword and raises it over Zed.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: One more word and you die--

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (putting on the harness) Okay, okay. I'm going. (to Marlak and

dialogues.speaker: ENMEBARAGESI
dialogues.text: Okay, boys, on the count of three. One-- two-- three! Marlak and Enmebaragesi lunge against the ropes, but Zed makes no effort to pull. They glare at him.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Learned that from Maya. Good trick, huh? Okay, together this time. Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White They pull together and the heavy cart starts to move.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 65 Zed, Marlak and Enmebaragesi haul the heavy cart of brick the very top of the tower. TWO BRICKLAYERS are working on the wall. Zed leans agains the wall next to them tb rest.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: How high you guys think we're going with this?

dialogues.speaker: BRICKLAYER ONE
dialogues.text: Up to Heaven, I guess. That's how tall they usually build 'em.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (looking up) That's ambitious.

dialogues.speaker: BRICKLAYER TWO
dialogues.text: We worked on the Tower of Babel. Now that was a ziggurat.

dialogues.speaker: BRICKLAYER ONE
dialogues.text: Incredible erection. Zed looks down at his crotch.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (MODESTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nothing. You should see it when I'm excited.

dialogues.speaker: BRICKLAYER ONE
dialogues.text: The tower.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Oh, right, the tower. Incredible erection. (snickers to himself)

dialogues.speaker: BRICKLAYER ONE
dialogues.text: See, the Egyptians are working on an entirely different concept. Four sides, slanting walls, pointy top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: BRICKLAYER TWO
dialogues.text: Like a pyramid?

dialogues.speaker: BRICKLAYER ONE
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: BRICKLAYER TWO
dialogues.text: Wow. Far out. Yet timeless in a way. A SLAVE CHILD approaches with a water bucket.

dialogues.speaker: SLAVE CHILD
dialogues.text: (to Zed) Want some water? As the child offers him the ladle, Zed recognizes her.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: You're from the village, aren't you? The child nods.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I bet you wish you were back there right now, don't you. The child nods again.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Well, don't give up. You're going to get home someday. Marlak kicks Zed from behind, knocking him over.

dialogues.speaker: MARLAK
dialogues.text: (standing over him) Who's going to take her there? The Chosen One? Marlak kicks gravel and dirt in Zed's face. Zed just lies there and takes it, feeling like he's failed everyone. Then he hears the beating of drums and trumpet fanfares coming from the temple square below.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 66 Oh and the other slaves are mustered by the guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Get in line! Now! Move!

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Where're we going?

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: To watch the sacrifice. The King demands it.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Is that compulsory? Because I saw one when I first got here and it made me a little sick-- The guard's whip catches him across the back.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Ow! Why don't you try using your words for a change?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 67 The square is filling up with people. The ROYAL PROCESSIO is moving to the seats of honor to watch the sacrifice. Cain is now among the Royal Guard having been promoted fo his treachery. He bows and helps the Queen to her seat.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (leering seductively) At your service, my lady. Anytime, anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: (FLIRTATIOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a depraved thought. You're so delightfully low. Absolute filth.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (SUAVELY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, your majesty. He touches his tongue to the tip of his nose and waggles eyebrows. The King arrives with Sargon to loud booing from the crow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: Are they booing me? How dare they!

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Your Highness, with all due respect, those were "Woos." They love you. They were "wooing" you. The King looks doubtfully at the hostile crowd.

dialogues.speaker: SARGON
dialogues.text: All is in readiness, Majesty.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: (glares at the King) What now? More virgins to sacrifice?

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: Yes, two, followers of the Chosen One, discovered by this loyal soldier. Cain bows to the King.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Just doing my duty.

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: And one more to demonstrate our own faith and charity. The King stands and makes a proclamation loud enough for everyone to hear.

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: In supplication to the Gods, for the love of the People, we offer a humble sacrifice to the sacred temple fire-- our own step- daughter, the Princess Inanna! The crowd gasps.

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: (to Inanna) For the good of the people.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN
dialogues.text: (stands in protest) You wouldn't dare!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official white

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: Wouldn't I? If you like, I could arrange for you to join her. The Queen slowly sits back down.

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: (to Inanna) How long did you think I'd tolerate your insolence? (to Sargon) Burn her.- Sargon and Cain seize Inanna, but she shrugs them off and rises with dignity.

dialogues.speaker: INANNA
dialogues.text: I'll see you all in Hell.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 68 The flames are starting to build inside the idol's mouth. 69 Oh and the slaves are confined behind a barrier, watched squad of guards, waiting for the ceremony to start. THE TEMPLE DOORS open slowly, and the High Priest appears holding a long jewelled staff. Oh turns to the EDOMITE SLAVE next to him.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (casually name-dropping) See the High Priest? I know him. Dear friend of mine.

dialogues.speaker: THE TEMPLE
dialogues.text: Now the procession of SACRIFICIAL VIRGINS is led out by t HIGH PRIESTESS. Maya and Eema are among them, their hands tied. They look like they've been drugged. Oh spots Eema and Maya among the virgins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (PANICKED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Eema! And Maya! I know them!

dialogues.speaker: EDOMITE SLAVE
dialogues.text: (SARCASTIC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you know everybody, don't you. Oh shoulders his way right up to the barrier where a BIG GUARD stops him with a spear to his neck.

dialogues.speaker: BIG GUARD
dialogues.text: That's far enough, slave. Oh stops right there, frustrated and frightened.

dialogues.speaker: THE TEMPLE
dialogues.text: Inanna is led out last, now also having been drugged. 70 Zed, Marlak and the sharp-eyed Enmebaragesi look down, tr to see what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: ENMEBARAGESI
dialogues.text: They're bringing out the women.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (AMAZED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you seeing that far?

dialogues.speaker: ENMEBARAGESI
dialogues.text: I see your sister, Eema--

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (SQUINTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Maya!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 71 The drums and trumpets kick up the tempo and the High Pri starts leading the virgins to the idol's fiery mouth. Oh pushes against the barrier, restrained by the guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: We have to do something! Somebody has to stop it. (turning to the other

dialogues.speaker: SLAVES
dialogues.text: We can't let them do this! The slaves start to mutter. The guards draw their swords heft their spears, now on high alert.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 72 Zed looks around desperately, trying to figure out what t do.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (to Marlak) I have to get down there.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: (SNORTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over my dead body.

dialogues.speaker: MARLAK
dialogues.text: All right. Without a moment's hesitation, Marlak grabs him and tosse him off the top of the ziggurat. He screams all the way down.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Wow. Who saw that coming? Thanks, Marlak.

dialogues.speaker: MARLAK
dialogues.text: Now what? Zed looks around quickly, grabs the end of a long coiled attached to a big pulley, and hands Marlak the other end.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (looping the rope around his waist) Lower me down. Without waiting for a response, Zed bravely jumps off the of the ziggurat holding the rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White Marlak looks at the rope in his hands, pulls it a little sees that it's not attached to the rope Zed was holding.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: He's descending rapidly, rappelling off the side of the ziggurat. He looks up, expecting Marlak to belay him and slow him down.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (CALLING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any time now, Marlak! Marlak and Enmebaragesi watch his descent, dumbly interes in what happens next. Zed sees he's not slowing down and tries to swing himself onto one of the upper levels of the ziggurat. However, wh he swings in, he hits a cart loaded with bricks and bounc off painfully.

dialogues.speaker: THE BRICK CART
dialogues.text: The sudden jolt dislodges the wheel chock that was holdin the cart on the sloping ramp of the tower. The cart start to roll down the ramp, gathering speed as it careens towa the edge.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 73 He raises his staff and invokes the Gods.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: We implore the great Gods of heaven to show us a sign that we may honor your divine will and be worthy of your blessing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White 74 The brick cart explodes through the scaffolding on the si of the ziggurat and sails into the air.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROYAL ENCLOSURE
dialogues.text: Everybody turns at the sound of the crash and looks up at ziggurat.

dialogues.speaker: THE BRICK PITS
dialogues.text: The NASTY GUARD who whipped Oh earlier glances up and is instantly crushed by a ton of falling bricks.

dialogues.speaker: THE ZIGGURAT
dialogues.text: Zed is still descending as the broken scaffolding starts give way.

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLE SQUARE
dialogues.text: The whole crowd watches in amazement as the 250 scaffolding slowly collapses and crashes to the ground, bringing tons of debris with it, sending up a great cloud dust.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: He looks shocked.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: He seizes the opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: A sign! It's a sign! The Chosen One comes! The other slaves and people in the crowd pick up his excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: CROWD
dialogues.text: The Chosen One! A sign from the Gods!

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: He doesn't quite know how to respond to the growing fervo the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: Yes! Well and truly, the Gods are with us-- The crowd drowns him out. 75 A guard is standing there staring at the rubble of the scaffolding as Zed comes screaming down the side of the ziggurat and lands right on top of him. Zed quickly strip the unconscious guard of his weapons, starts to run off, stops, comes back and grabs the guard's helmet, then take off running to the temple square.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: 76 The High Priest is getting frantic now.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: Burn them! Now! He grabs Maya and starts dragging her toward the gaping m of the idol and the raging fire within. She struggles but too drugged to put up much resistance. He grabs the sacramental pitcher of oil and starts sloppily anointing

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: (RUSHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May the balm of this healing oil soothe your journey through the sacred fire! (DESPERATELY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fight it! It's the will of the Gods! Then, a voice from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (SHOUTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so! Zed is standing atop the idol's head, brandishing a sword shield.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: She sees him and starts to revive.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Zed!

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: looks up, unable to hear Zed over the crowd noise.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: (cupping his ear) What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (SHOUTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, 'I don't think so!'

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Still not getting it. Zed rolls his eyes in frustration and starts tentatively climbing down from the top of the idol. He jumps the last few feet and lands right in front of the fire, blocking t High Priest's way.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I Said, 'I don't think so.'

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: (CONFUSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think what?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Whatever that last thing you said was.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: (THINKS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot. (SHOUTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guards!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White Guards rush toward Zed from all sides, but he fights like demon, slashing, spinning, stabbing, fending off their bl with his shield. Oh is inspired by Zed's courage.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (to the Edomite slave) I know him, too. Oh springs into action, attacking the big guard in front him. The other slaves see that and start fighting with th guards, a genuine slave revolt.

dialogues.speaker: THE CROWD
dialogues.text: Guards start moving to help their comrades, but the spiri insurrection takes hold of the crowd and people start grappling with the guards. A PLATOON OF REINFORCEMENTS comes double-timing into the square. Suddenly, A STOOPED OLD MAN throws off his cloak and pull sword. It's Abraham!

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: Death to the idolators! Abraham's small army of HEBREWS reveal themselves, draw t weapons and attack the reinforcements. The last Hebrew to unrobe is Isaac, who just stands there observing the growing chaos.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) Just fucking nuts. 77 They come running into the battle swinging clubs, randoml bashing heads of soldiers and innocent civilians alike. Cain sees Marlak and stands his ground.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: Tough guy, huh? You want a piece of me? Get ready to have your head bashed in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White As Cain raises his truncheon, Marlak HEAD-BUTTS him.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (nose bleeding, stunned) Nice move! He passes out and goes down. 78 He starts to panic at the full-scale revolt and rises nervously. His ministers surround him, he thinks to prote him.

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: I knew I could depend on your loyalty. The ministers all draw daggers from their robes and move for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: KING
dialogues.text: (MUTTERS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assholes. He falls to their flashing knives. 79 Oh fights his way to the temple stairs, runs up and confr a PRIEST who is trying to drag Eema away. He fights with very little skill but tremendous energy, finally overwhel the guard and grabbing Eema.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (suddenly shy again) Hello, Eema.

dialogues.speaker: EEMA
dialogues.text: (still a little dazed) Oh? He stares at her full red lips and big blue eyes.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (suddenly forceful) Eema, you're my woman! You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: EEMA
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Really? It's okay? He pulls her into an embrace and kisses her hard on the mouth. Then, out of the corner of his eye, Oh sees a guar rushing at him. Oh whirls and falls off the platform, accidentally cutting the guards legs out from under him. 80 While Zed is busy with the guards, the High Priest pulls toward the fire. Zed sees him, finishes the last of the guards, and starts slowly moving toward the High Priest who starts backing a until he sees Oh moving toward him from the other side. H holds the helpless Maya close to the flames.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: (screaming and crying) Keep away!

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Let her go.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: (his mascara running) No! The Gods demand a sacrifice! And you ruined it! He wrestles Maya even closer to the fire.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (trying to keep him calm) Why don't we just sacrifice something small-- a rabbit maybe. Or a duck. That'd be good, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: (SCREAMS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! A duck would not be good!

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: Then how about this? The High Priest turns to Oh. Oh is holding the big sacramental pitcher.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: More oil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White He splashes the High Priest with a gallon of oil, soaking from head to toe. As the oil hits the High Priest, Zed dashes across and snatches Maya from his grasp. The High Priest spins around in a rage, his long robes wr around his legs hobbling him, he totters on his high plat shoes, loses his balance and gets too close to the idol's fiery mouth. Totally drenched in oil, he bursts into flam like a human torch, screams, and staggers right into the mouth of the furnace.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH PRIEST
dialogues.text: (SCREAMS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot!

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLE SQUARE
dialogues.text: Everyone goes silent, stunned by the incredible turn of events. All eyes turn to Zed and Oh, now standing before them on the center stage of the temple.

dialogues.speaker: ZED AND OH
dialogues.text: They look at each other. Someone has to say something. Finally, Zed clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I'm the, uh, Chosen One, I guess, and on behalf of, well, the whole city, I want to thank the High Priest for his incredible sacrifice. That was really something, wasn't it? He starts clapping, then Oh starts clapping, and soon all people in the square are applauding. At that moment a single drop of rain falls and hits Zed i the eye. He looks up, a few more drops, then a hard stead rain starts to fall. The people all look up in awe, then someone cheers and th all roar in celebration. Then the rain stops as suddenly it started. The cheers die away, and confused, dissatisfi muttering begins.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (jumping in quickly) People! Friends! Sodomites! Okay, that was a little confusing, wasn't it? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Was that a sign from God? Wasn't it a sign? What's the deal? We all want to know. But I'm not sure anybody really knows-- and I'd be real suspicious of people who say they do. If I've learned one thing, it's this: the world and everything in it is a miracle. And what that miracle means is for each and every one of us to figure out for himself. Are the Gods going to destroy us? Maybe-- I don't know-- I guess it's possible. But if we keep going the way we are, they won't have to. We're doing a pretty good job of destroying ourselves. So maybe we should all just go home now, and think about what happened-- and be very, very good to each other. I know I'm going to try. (raises his hand in salute to the people) Peace. The crowd stares at him blankly. Nobody knows what to mak of it all. Then Marlak shouts loud enough for all to hear

dialogues.speaker: MARLAK
dialogues.text: All hail the Chosen One! With that the crowd explodes into rousing cheers. In the midst of the crowd, Abraham looks around and scowl

dialogues.speaker: ABRAHAM
dialogues.text: What am I? Chopped liver? At the altar, Maya, revived now, embraces Zed.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: You're incredible, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: That's what I've been trying to tell you. Zed and Maya, Oh and Eema stand there basking in the gratitude of the people as Inanna looks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official white 81 A caravan is assembling, making ready to leave the city. Marlak, Enmebaragesi, Maya, Eema and the other villagers there, as well as a great number of freed slaves and Hebr Isaac is checking out Maya's breasts.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: Hey, babe. Ever made it with a circumcised guy? Marlak grunts at him and reaches for his knife.

dialogues.speaker: ISAAC
dialogues.text: (BACKPEDALING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she with you? I did not realize that. Sorry. Marlak and Maya cross to Zed who is loading a packhorse. Marlak looks at him for a long moment then punches him ha on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: MARLAK
dialogues.text: (GRUDGING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did good. Zed waits for more, but nothing comes.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: (rubbing his shoulder) Well said, Marlak. You really have a way with words. They clasp hands.

dialogues.speaker: MARLAK
dialogues.text: We'll tell stories about you around the fire.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Not much to tell, is there? Just an average guy who saw his destiny and had the courage to defy a powerful empire. No big deal. Oh is at the front of the caravan, giving orders, but no is listening to him. Zed joins him.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Everybody ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (WORRIED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just about-- I guess so. The Hebrews are going to lead us to the sea and we can get boats from there. We can trade all this stuff everybody gave us for the trip home. (NERVOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I should be the leader. Nobody's listening to me.

dialogues.speaker: EEMA
dialogues.text: (by his side) I'll listen to you. Oh swells up with pride.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (turns to Zed) Come back to the village sometime. Zed nods, they shake hands, then they embrace. Stifling a tear, Oh breaks away and whips the lead camel.

dialogues.speaker: OH
dialogues.text: (shouting at camel) Hee-ya! (beat, quietly to camel) Come on. People are watching. The camel looks at him and slowly lumbers off. Oh sighs gratefully and signals the caravan to follow. As the great caravan moves off, Zed is left standing ther with nothing but a long staff, and a bundle on the ground beside him to which is tied his sword, shield and helmet. Maya joins him.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Where will you go now?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Might head down to Egypt. I hear it's a happening kinda place.

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: Are you going alone?

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Not necessarily. You want to come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: I'll get my things. She gestures off and he sees a small train of camels and horses loaded with a ton of her personal possessions. MAYA (cont'd) The Princess gave me a few gifts when she freed us.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: Traveling light, huh? Okay, here we go. (POINTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the west!

dialogues.speaker: MAYA
dialogues.text: (correcting him) That's west.

dialogues.speaker: ZED
dialogues.text: I knew that. Just wanted to see if you did. Zed grins and they start walking, passing a small herd of sheep and goats, tended by VEILED WOMEN, going in the opposite direction. As THE LAST OF THE SHEPHERD WOMEN passes, we notice somet masculine about her build and posture. Zed nods politely her, but she averts her eyes and turns away from him.

dialogues.speaker: CAIN
dialogues.text: (in a high unconvincing woman's voice) Peace--- brother. zed does a double take at the voice, shrugs, and walks of with Maya-- as a torrential rain begins to fall.
